We are looking forward to your application!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Technical Designer - ARC Raiders
description:
We are looking for a Technical Designer to join ARC Raiders game teams here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering ~100 developers.
  
In this role you will be responsible for the technical design work by creating, implementing, and maintaining tools, systems, & other workflows as a bridge between design and code.
  
You will collaborate closely with the Design Director and other Designers of the project, as well as Production leadership helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
  
Example of responsibilities
  
Help design and prove new features by developing prototypes for the design team to experiment with
  
Help identify technical pitfalls and challenges in our designs, offering possible solutions or alternatives
  
Contribute tool and workflow improvement ideas, especially design tools
  
Help design, balance, and tweak our more technical gameplay systems, for example activity spawning or loot distribution
  
Work with other disciplines to help align design intent with non-design pipelines and tech
  
  

We would love if you have
  
Around 5+ years of experience within technical design making games
  
A good grasp of AAA PvP/PvE gameplay and systems design, including player psychology, UX design, and gameplay mechanics & dynamics
  
Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience in scripting and blueprints
  
Knowledge of the UnrealEngine-Angelscript plugin is a big plus, but not required
  
Knowledge of programming languages such as C#, Lua, or Python
  
A creative and curious mind
  
A good knowledge or familiarity with other game making disciplines such as animation, UX, 3D Art, etc.
  
A great creative collaborator in cross disciplinary groups
  
Professional English communication skills
  
  

At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together. We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability. Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table. Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior UX Designer – med affärsdriv och strategiskt tänk
description:
Är du en erfaren UX-designer som brinner för att skapa användarupplevelser som gör verklig skillnad – både för användaren och för affären? Vi söker nu en Senior UX Designer som vill ta en strategisk och affärsnära roll i ett engagerat designteam med stort inflytande över både användarupplevelse och affärsutveckling.
  
Om rollen
  
I den här rollen får du möjlighet att arbeta med både externa och interna digitala lösningar – allt från kommersiella webbplatser till interna plattformar och partnerverktyg. Ditt fokus kommer att ligga på att förbättra kundresor, driva engagemang och designa lösningar som skapar konkret affärsnytta.
  
Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam, affärsstakeholders, marknadsfunktioner och andra UX-designers – i en miljö där samarbete, kommersiellt tänk och användarcentrering står i centrum.
  
Exempel på arbetsuppgifter
  
  

* Utveckla och implementera UX-strategier kopplade till övergripande affärsmål
* Genomföra research och analys av användarbeteenden med fokus på konvertering, retention eller effektivisering
* Skapa customer journeys och service blueprints för att identifiera förbättringsområden
* Designa användarvänliga gränssnitt som stödjer både användar- och affärsbehov
* Leda workshops och co-creation-sessioner med tvärfunktionella team
* Coacha andra UX-designers och bidra till att höja UX-mognaden i organisationen


Vi söker dig som har
  
  

* 5+ års erfarenhet inom UX eller produktdesign
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva designprocesser från research till leverans
* Stark förmåga att koppla UX-arbete till affärsstrategier och kommersiella mål
* Kompetens inom service design, design thinking och customer journey mapping
* Vana att kommunicera med olika stakeholders, inklusive produktägare, marknad och affärsutveckling
* Tidigare erfarenhet av större organisationer, gärna inom B2B-miljöer


**Meriterande:**  

* Erfarenhet av agila team och digitala plattformar
* Förståelse för konverteringsoptimering och datadrivet designarbete
* Erfarenhet av responsiva webbapplikationer eller samarbete med marknads- och growthteam


Varför du ska söka
  
Här får du inte bara jobba med UX på djupet – utan också vara en del av en organisation där UX ses som en strategisk del av affären. Du får möjlighet att påverka på riktigt och bidra till digitala lösningar som både engagerar användare och driver affärsresultat.
  
Ansök direkt eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Distanslärare Media Folkhögskola
company: Ideella fören LOs folkhögskola Runö med firmaRun
description:
Folkhögskolan mitt i Stockholm
  
Vår initiativtagare och huvudman är föreningen LOs folkhögskola Runö. Runö folkhögskola vänder sig till dig med kort formell utbildning.
  
På Runö folkhögskola läser våra deltagare kurser som ger möjlighet till högre studier på till exempel universitet eller yrkeshögskola. Du vistas i en inspirerande miljö med människor från olika delar av världen. Det ger nya insikter som får dig och dina studiekamrater att växa.
  
Engagemang, diskussion och att vara del av något större är några av de saker som kännetecknar Runö folkhögskola.
  
Runö folkhögskola har nära samarbete med flera demokratiska rörelser. Kontakter och utbyte med dessa är en naturlig del av skolans profil. Vi ger dig en förståelse av hur och varför du kan organisera dig för att uppnå förändring och påverka din livssituation.
  
Alla kurser på Runö folkhögskola vilar på värderingar om ett samhälle präglat av frihet, rättvisa, jämställdhet, jämlikhet och solidaritet. Vi arbetar för att alla människor ska ha lika värde och lika rätt.
  
Vi söker nu en lärare som har lång erfarenhet av att undervisa på distans.
  
  

**KRAV:**  

* WORDPRESS/ HTML/CSS, UX/UI, ANIMATE, AFTER EFFECTS och mediekommunikation
* Erfarenhet av distansundervisning


Vi söker dig som är lösningsfokuserad, har ett gott bemötande, lyhörd, flexibel och tålmodig. Du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra samtidigt som du kan arbeta självständigt och "ser vad som behöver göras". Stor vikt fästs vid personlig lämplighet. Du ska ha intresse av att utföra sedvanliga läraruppgifter. Erfarenhet av WORDPRESS/ HTML/CSS, UX/UI, ANIMATE, AFTER EFFECTS och mediekommunikation samt intresse och erfarenhet av teknik/IT-stöd är meriterande.
  
Beskrivning av arbetsuppgifter
  
Att vara lärare och professionell pedagog på Runö Folkhögskola innebär att du har höga förväntningar och en tro på att alla deltagare kan nå framgång utifrån sina förutsättningar. Du skapar goda relationer, såväl med deltagare som med kollegor byggda på förtroende och respekt. Du är medveten om din egen påverkan på deltagarnas lärande. Med utgångspunkt i deltagarnas resultat, forskning och beprövad erfarenhet, följer du upp undervisningens kvalitet, reflekterar och utvärderar i syfte att utveckla undervisningen. Du ger framåtsyftande återkoppling till deltagarna med syfte till utveckling och stöttar deltagare i behov av särskilt stöd. Vi arbetar med kollegialt lärande vilket innebär att du samarbetar med kollegor för att utveckla dig själv och din undervisning samt skolans pedagogiska arbete. Du ska vara digitalt driven och ha utvecklade strategier för hur du digitaliserar ditt arbete med våra deltagare.
  
  

ÖVRIGT
  
Lön och anställningsvillkor
  
Annonsen avser en tidsbegränsad anställning 1 år, 60-80%.
  
Tillträde 250811 eller efter överenskommelse.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och personligt brev senast 250718.
  
Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta studierektor Ann Andersson Tel: 076-569 67 98 eller via mejl ann.andersson@runo.se
  
Anställning sker under förutsättning att erforderliga beslut fattas.
  
Giltigt utdrag ur polisens belastningsregister visas upp alternativt lämnas in före anställning.
  
Tänk på att det kan ta tid att få utdraget så beställ det i god tid för att rekryteringsprocessen inte ska fördröjas.
  
  

Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt kontakt med annons- och bemanningsföretag i rekryteringen.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
### **Your New Role**


We are looking for an experienced Technical Project Manager to lead digital development efforts in a key area of a global industrial organization’s R&D process. This role focuses on improving how test vehicles are planned, procured, built, and tracked across the product lifecycle. You will collaborate closely with product managers, UX designers, and development teams to translate complex business needs into efficient, technical solutions.


As a senior consultant in this role, your main responsibilities will include:  

* Driving the structuring and refinement of digital solutions and backlogs
* Acting as a bridge between business needs and technical delivery
* Supporting agile software development with a focus on AngularJS frontend and Java backend
* Contributing to early discovery and technical assessments
* Mentoring team members and encouraging best practices

### **To succeed in this role, you will need:**

* Solid background in IT project management, preferably in agile environments


* Experience with software development, especially Java and/or AngularJS


* Strong skills in stakeholder communication and change management


* Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements


* Fluent English (spoken and written)

  


  



### **Who You Are**


You are a structured and collaborative leader with a strong technical understanding and a passion for digital innovation. You thrive in cross-functional teams, enjoy mentoring others, and are driven by creating real value through digital tools. Curiosity about industrial product development and continuous improvement mindset are key to your success.

### **We look forward to receiving your application**


Scope of employment: 100%
  

Type of contract: Fixed-term employment
  

Salary: According to agreement  

Start date: 2025-08-11
  

End date: 2026-02-06, with the possibility of extension
  

Application deadline: 2025-06-25  

Selected benefits: Collective agreement, wellness allowance, Benifex  

In your application: Ensure your application clearly demonstrates how you meet the client’s required qualifications

### **Good to Know**


Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. As recruitment processes in the consulting industry can move quickly, the position may be filled before the application deadline – so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.  

  

There’s no need to submit a cover letter; instead, please respond to the screening questions included in the application.### **Company Presentation**


Our client is a global industrial group, leading the development of innovative and sustainable solutions for the transport and infrastructure sectors. With a long history and a strong focus on the future, they offer a dynamic work environment where technology, collaboration, and quality are at the core. Here, you will have the opportunity to be part of an organization contributing to a more sustainable world.

title: Produktansvarig – Statistik & Analys till Svenskt Näringsliv
description:
Vill du bidra till att ta fram lönestatistik som används av den privata arbetsmarknaden över hela Sverige? Svenskt Näringsliv söker en **Produktansvarig – Statistik & Analys** med ansvar för utveckling och förvaltning av rapportmodulen i vårt IT-system för Näringslivets lönestatistik (NLS). Det här är en roll för dig som vill arbeta praktiskt med statistik och bidra till att skapa beslutsunderlag som används i avtalsförhandlingar och av arbetsgivare i hela landet.

**Om rollen**  

Du ansvarar för resultatdelen i Svenskt Näringslivs lönestatistikarbete – det vill säga den rapportmodul som sammanställer, visualiserar och gör statistiken användbar för våra olika målgrupper. Du samarbetar med utvecklare, statistiker, verksamhetsrepresentanter och användare för att säkerställa att rätt rapporter tas fram på ett effektivt sätt. Du kommer också att leda framtagandet av nya rapporter utifrån verksamhetens behov.


Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

* Ansvara för kravställning och utveckling av vår rapportmodul, som baseras på SAS-rapportmodulen
* Testa och dokumentera nya funktioner och förbättringar
* Säkerställa att krav, testrutiner och testfall är definierade och följs i samarbete med utvecklare
* Hantera backlog inom ditt produktområde
* Vara stöd till användare – både internt och externt – genom support, information och utbildning
* Delta i dagliga stand-ups med utvecklingsteamet

**Din bakgrund**


Vi söker dig med:

* Akademisk utbildning inom systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område
* Intresse för statistik, analys och rapportering


Meriterande: erfarenhet av UX, SAS-rapportmodul eller PM3


Du är nyfiken, analytisk och självgående – men också en god lagspelare. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan verksamhet, data och IT, och gillar att göra komplex information tillgänglig. Vi ser även att du har god struktur, ett siffersinne och trivs med att ha koll på detaljer. Du är trygg med att tala inför andra och kommunicerar väl med både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper.

**Vad vi erbjuder**  

Hos oss blir du en del av en organisation med ett viktigt uppdrag som handlar om att påverka och förbättra villkoren för företagande i Sverige. Vi arbetar utifrån vår vision om ett växande näringsliv i ett fritt samhälle. Som medarbetare erbjuder vi dig en stimulerande och attraktiv arbetsmiljö, inklusive generöst friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och förmånliga försäkringar. Vårt kontor ligger centralt på Storgatan 19 i Stockholm. Du blir omgiven av engagerade kollegor som brinner för att förbättra förutsättningarna för företag i Sverige.

**Ansökan**  

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Svenskt Näringsliv med Ants. Det ska inte vara krångligt att söka jobb hos oss. Har du inget uppdaterat CV redo räcker det gott och väl att du ger oss din LinkedIn-profil och svarar på några korta frågor om din bakgrund. Ansökan tar bara några minuter och kan göras via din telefon.


Återkoppling och intervjuer sker i augusti.

 ***Om Svenskt Näringsliv***

*Vi vill att dagens och morgondagens företag ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att starta, driva och utveckla sin verksamhet. Vi tar fram förslag på åtgärder och reformer som gagnar företagsklimatet. Vi sprider kunskap och bildar opinion. Vi företräder företagen i samtal med fackliga organisationer och myndigheter och ger det svenska näringslivet en röst i EU.*

*Vår vision är ett växande näringsliv i ett fritt samhälle. Med det menar vi att dagens och morgondagens företag ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att starta, driva och utveckla sin verksamhet. Sverige ska ha högre tillväxt än andra länder och det svenska näringslivet ska växa snabbare än globala konkurrenter.*  

  

*Vi företräder 60 000 små, medelstora och stora företag. Dessa är organiserade i 49 bransch- och arbetsgivarförbund. Förbunden utgör föreningen Svenskt Näringslivs medlemmar.*

title: UX-designer Distans Castra Mellansverige
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*

**Rollen**


Castra Mellansverige växer och vi söker dig som vill vara med på resan. Vi söker nu en UX-designer som vill jobba på distans. UX-designkompetens efterfrågas främst vid utveckling av nya moduler, för att säkerställa god användarupplevelse och tillgänglighet.

**Erfarenhet**


Vi ser att du har:  

  



* Erfarenhet av att designa användargränssnitt i samverkan med användare.
* God kommunikativ förmåga, både gentemot tekniska team och verksamhetsrepresentanter
* Förmåga att dokumentera designlösningar och dess struktur.
* Analytisk förmåga och förståelse för verksamhetsbehov.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder


Låter detta som du? Skicka in ditt CV redan idag!

**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**

  

Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite-squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.


Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste fyra åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag.


På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, egen upphandlingsenhet, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna väldigt nära oändliga. Win win för alla parter, säger vi.


Castra har kontor i Örebro, Karlstad, Linköping, Norrköping, Jönköping, Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö och Sundsvall. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida https://www.castra.se/om-oss/

 **Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**


Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta oss:


Jenny Liljeson jenny.liljeson@castra.se


Moa Serneholt moa.serneholt@castra.se

title: Junior Web Editor
description:
**Securitas Group**


For 90 years, we have helped keep your world safe. It's a purpose we continue to pursue in today's complex and ever-changing world because everyone deserves to feel safe.


Securitas is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that **help make your world a safer place**. By leveraging technology in collaboration with our clients, we provide a comprehensive portfolio of value-enhancing services and solutions integrated throughout the security value chain – from on-site services to advanced monitoring, comprehensive risk prediction, and advisory services.


Guided by our values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness, we create sustainable value by assisting our clients in optimizing their operations and protecting what matters most - their people and assets. With more than 330,000 colleagues across 44 markets and nine decades of deep expertise, we see what others miss and create sustainable value for our clients.


We’re now looking for a **Junior Web Editor** to **join our Group Communications team** — someone who thrives on structure, coordination, and digital innovation.

**About the role**


As our new Junior Web Editor, you’ll play a key role in managing and evolving our digital presence. In this role, you’ll act as a key coordinator across teams, ensuring that web content is accurate, timely, and aligned with business goals while also supporting the technical and operational aspects of our digital platforms.


You’ll work closely with developers, designers, and communicators to keep our Group website running smoothly and effectively. In this role, you’ll collaborate with stakeholders across international markets and at Group level, ensuring alignment and consistency in our digital presence. Your ability to bring structure, manage multiple stakeholders, and stay ahead of deadlines will be essential. You’ll also play a role in exploring how AI tools can support smarter workflows and more efficient content operations.


This is a great opportunity to grow in a **global organization**, working with a **small, collaborative team** that values initiative, clarity, and continuous improvement.

**Your responsibilities**

* Coordinating updates and improvements to the Group website and other digital platforms.
* Acting as a liaison between content owners, developers, and designers to ensure smooth execution of web projects.
* Maintaining structured processes for content updates, approvals, and publishing.
* Monitoring content accuracy, consistency, and performance and flag opportunities for improvement.
* Supporting the integration of AI-powered tools to streamline workflows, enhance quality control, and improve user experience.
* Tracking and reporting on web performance metrics using tools like GA4.
* Ensuring content aligns with SEO, accessibility, and UX best practices.
* This role may also include additional tasks and responsibilities beyond those listed above, depending on team needs and your interests and strengths.

**Who you are**

  

* You bring **3****–5 years of experience** in web coordination, digital communications, or content planning, creation and management.
* You have a degree in Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or another related field.
* You are comfortable working with **CMS platforms** and have a basic understanding of HTML/CSS. You are familiar with SEO, UX/UI principles, and web analytics (especially GA4).
* You are a strong communicator in **English** (Swedish is a plus), with a collaborative mindset and attention to detail.
* You are organized, proactive, and thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
* You are a team player who also works well independently and takes initiative.

**Working conditions**


The role is based in Stockholm and involves occasional travel as needed. It's a hybrid working model.

 **Why join us?**

* Be part of a strong, purpose-driven organization guided by clear values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness.
* Join a team of experts in external communications, internal communications, PR, and crisis communications, all working together to elevate our brand and impact.
* Work in a collaborative, supportive environment that values structure, innovation, and initiative.
* Enjoy opportunities for professional growth, cross-functional collaboration, and meaningful contributions to high-impact projects.


If you’re ready to bring structure, coordination, and curiosity to a dynamic digital team, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Staff Engineer - Product Architecture
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**

*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*

**Staff Engineer - Product Architecture**


Are you a senior technical leader ready to own the architectural direction within a product domain? As our **Staff Engineer, Product Architecture**, you'll be the ultimate owner of our product's technical blueprint, ensuring systems perfectly align with business and user needs while upholding the highest non-functional requirements.  

  

At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.


This is a critical role where you'll be deeply embedded within product teams, bridging vision and execution. You'll provide essential **leadership, mentorship, and final accountability** on technical decisions, guiding our product development teams to make excellent choices.

**Your Day-to-Day Mission:**

* **Architectural Ownership:** Define and own the overall product architecture and technical roadmap for your area, ensuring designs are resilient, observable, scalable, performant, highly available, secure, and maintainable.
* **People Leadership:** Guide and mentor Tech Leads, fostering cross-team alignment and cultivating a shared understanding of architecture and design patterns. You'll be the final escalation point for complex technical decisions.
* **Strategic Collaboration:** Work closely with Product Managers to translate user and business needs into robust technical strategies. Collaborate with Principal Engineers to align product architecture with broader platform strategies.
* **Quality & Delivery:** Establish and uphold high standards of code quality, test coverage, and performance. Proactively manage architectural risks and tech debt, contributing to continuous improvement across the engineering group.
* **Process Excellence:** Lead architecture reviews, participate in design discussions, and coach teams in applying agile principles to architecture. Contribute to long-term technology strategy and ensure architectural documentation is always current.

**What We're Looking For:**

* **Proven Technical Leadership:** 10+ years of experience as a technical leader in a large organization, with a track record of guiding teams through significant transformations.
* **Hands-On Expertise:** Solid background as a Senior Software Engineer in an agile environment. You still enjoy diving into code when time permits.
* **Collaborative Spirit:** A natural collaborator eager to work closely with engineering, product, and UX leaders to build exceptional products.
* **Growth Mindset:** A strong advocate for continuous learning and growth, both personally and for those around you.
* **Mentorship Passion:** A genuine passion for mentoring and supporting engineers and teams, helping them achieve their full potential.
* **Commitment to Quality:** A deep understanding of the importance of scalable, sustainable, and architecturally sound solutions, with a dedication to delivering high-quality code.
* **Adaptability and Judgment:** The ability to navigate ambiguity with confidence and make sound decisions when needed.
* **Empathetic Leadership:** A compassionate approach to leadership, adapting your style to meet the unique needs of individuals and situations.
* **Inclusive Culture:** A commitment to fostering a fun, inclusive, and welcoming environment for everyone on the team.  

  

**About us**  

*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
 



  





 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers to bring your ideas to life—creating products that are both beautiful and usable. Depending on your experience, you might implement parts of the frontend yourself or work alongside developers to ensure your vision is realized in the final product.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Product Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We're looking for an experienced Product Manager to help shape our product discovery —focusing on navigation and product listing pages. You'll work closely with a Senior PM to deliver intuitive, inspiring ways for customers to find what they love, driving initiatives around tailored exploration, nudged browsing, and findability. This role bridges product design, engineering, analytics, and stakeholders, ensuring solutions are customer-centric, data-informed, and strategically aligned.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

- Leading the discovery, delivery, and iteration of key initiatives.

- Translating customer and business needs into clear problem statements, product requirements, and prioritized backlogs.

- Collaborating closely with UX, engineering, analytics, and stakeholders to bring new experiences to life - from concept to release.

 Defining, monitor, and report on success metrics (e.g. CTR, engagement rates, PLP
 - Driving test, experimentation, and customer validation to generate insights that inform product improvements and strategic decisions.

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll join a global, cross-functional team committed to delivering exceptional digital experiences through close collaboration, user-centric design, and continuous iteration. The team brings together diverse expertise across Product Design, Analytics, and Engineering, and partners closely with other product teams within the global digital experience organization, as well as key business stakeholders.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Proven experience as a Product Manager within a digital environment.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* A passion for solving complex problems with innovative thinking and a clear ability to prioritize based on impact, user value, and strategic fit.
* A strong customer focus, with the ability to uncover user needs, validate pain points, and translate insights into actionable improvements.


*And people who have:*
* A data-informed mindset, using both qualitative and quantitative insights to guide decision-making.
* Experience working in agile, iterative product development environments.
* A proactive, ownership-driven attitude with the ability to manage ambiguity and adapt quickly to change.
* Curiosity and a continuous improvement mindset—always looking for ways to enhance the product and the team’s ways of working.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Marketing Designer
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At
 **360Player** 
 , we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading
 **all-in-one Club Operating System** 
 , we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics. Trusted by top clubs such as
 **Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona** 
 and
 **Rafa Nadal Academy** 
 , our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a creative and hands-on
 **Marketing Designer** 
 to join our growing team. In this role you’ll work closely with our marketing team. You will visually communicate our message across a wide range of channels—from presentations and social media to trade shows. You’ll also help shape the visual identity of our internal and external web presence. This is a great opportunity for someone early in their design career who wants to grow, learn, and be part of a collaborative and fast-moving environment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design engaging content for presentations, social media, trade shows, and marketing campaigns
* Create graphics for video
* Contribute to the visual design of our website and internal platforms
* Set up templates and design systems for recurring content (ads, slides, visuals)
* Collaborate with team members across departments and support internal stakeholders
* Work closely with our marketing and product teams to ensure brand consistency


**What We’re Looking For**
* At least 3 years of experience in graphic or marketing design, and a relevant education
* Strong skills in the Adobe Creative Suite: InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, as well as in Canva
* Experience with layout tools – experience with Figma is a plus
* Experience in web design – experience in Webflow is a plus
* Experience with motion graphics and simple animations - experience in After Effects is a plus
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written
* Spanish language skills is a nice-to-have, not a must-have


**Personal Qualities**
* A team player who enjoys working with others and exchanging ideas
* Positive and proactive attitude – you’re not afraid to try new things
* Service-minded and communicative – you enjoy supporting others and making things look great
* Curious and open to feedback – you want to grow and evolve in your role


**Why 360Player?**
* Be part of a fast-growing company with opportunities for advancement.
* Be part of a collaborative, friendly, and fast-paced team
* Learn from experienced marketers while shaping your own path
* Help define how we visually communicate with the world


**How To Apply**
 Excited about this opportunity? If you have a passion for design and marketing, apply your
 **portfolio** 
 (attached or via link), resume, and a short cover letter explaining why you’re the right fit for this role. We review applications on a rolling basis – don’t wait to apply!

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Are you a hands-on designer with a knack for business, a collaborative spirit, and a vision to shape a company? Join us at Common Ground and be part of our close-knit team of designers creating great user experiences.
 



  





**We think you might be a great fit if you:** 



* Have 8+ years of experience designing digital products in collaboration with product managers, engineers, and users
* Inspire and lead without needing a title. Your work and feedback elevate those around you.
* Care about the outcomes for users and the business. It’s not just about shipping; it’s about making an impact.
* Thrive in small teams, setting high standards, sharing knowledge, and pushing everyone to be their best.
* Have experience within consulting.
* Feel excited about the possibility of shaping the future of Common Ground



  





**What we offer:** 



* A chance to shape the future of Common Ground
* The opportunity to work on meaningful projects with a supportive team of senior designers and researchers.
* A balanced, sustainable work culture that blends professional excellence with personal well-being.
* 80% client allocation. The rest of the time is devoted to exploration, learning and having fun together.
* A fun and friendly workplace where we all love to hang out with each other.



  





**Sound like a fit?** 




 We’d love to hear from you. Send your portfolio and a quick hello to:
 



 jobs@commonground.se

title: Senior Product Designer (Sweden or Denmark)
description:
At
 **Zacco** 
 , we’re redefining the world of intellectual property through innovation, digital tools, and world-class expertise. With over 150 years of experience and a future-focused mindset, Zacco blends legal, tech, and strategic advisory to help clients protect and maximize their ideas.
   

  

 One of our flagship products,
 **IPview** 
 , is a powerful software platform used by clients across industries to manage their IP portfolios with precision and clarity.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 to help us elevate IPview’s user experience, drive design excellence across our platform, and play a critical role in shaping how innovation will transform IP.
   

  

**You Bring**
* 8–10 years of product design experience in fast-paced, high-impact environments
* A strong portfolio showcasing thoughtful UX, clean and effective UI design, and real-world impact
* A strategic mindset and desire to shape product direction beyond individual features
* Strong systems thinking and the ability to simplify complex workflows through design
* Comfort balancing design excellence with technical feasibility and business needs
* Clear and confident communication in English, both written and verbal
* Experience taking briefs and translating them into scalable design systems and solutions
* A high standard of design quality — from initial concept to final implementation
* Familiarity with or contribution to design systems (bonus if you’ve helped build one)
* A knack for inspiring others — aligning teams around a shared visual vision and motivating stakeholders to deliver on it
* A collaborative spirit and the ability to work seamlessly with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders


****Qualities we are looking for:****
* Self-motivated, with a passion for design and excellent digital user experiences
* A strong drive to make things better and ship great products
* Strong communication skills and an ability to articulate design decisions clearly
* A problem solver who thrives in reducing complexity and creating intuitive solutions
* A challenger of the status quo — you’re not afraid to ask “why”
* A team player who thrives in feedback-rich environments and iterates fast


****What We Offer****
* A high-impact role shaping a platform used by thousands of professionals
* A unique opportunity to modernize a critical tool within the IP space
* Executive support and investment in UX and design quality
* A collaborative and inclusive team with a flat hierarchy and open culture
* Competitive salary, benefits, and (where applicable) equity packages
* Flexible work setup – willing to be in the office 2-3 days a week.
* Your home office will either be Zacco’s Stockholm or Copenhagen office.
* The chance to join a forward-thinking company with a strong reputation and a clear vision for the future


 This role will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer.
   

  

**Apply now** 
 – we are managing applications and interviews on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 First interviews will initially be held on Teams and a final interview in-person.
   

  

**Why Join Zacco**
 You’ll be part of a collaborative, international team with opportunities to contribute to global initiatives, participate in strategy discussions, and share best practices. You will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer who is based in Stockholm.
   

  

 ZACCO has a flexible working policy. This means that employees are expected to work from the office for 3 days per week.
   

  

 As an employee of Zacco, this means that you are employed in an international organization that offers many opportunities to participate in and develop projects and assignments across regions, cultures and countries.
   

  

 The company works with all types of clients: large, international clients, small and medium-sized clients and local start-ups. Zacco offers an exciting environment in which employees can develop themselves and where you can learn from the best in the industry - and we are proud of both our experts and what we do at Zacco: We take care of all our clients' intellectual property rights, even those they don't know they have. We work proactively, often in tailor-made teams, to meet our clients' needs, and we have an ambitious and motivating work culture.
   

  

 Zacco is characterised by a Scandinavian work culture, as most of the company's offices are located in Scandinavia and Northern Europe. This means that Zacco has a flat organisational structure and that future employees can expect to be involved "from day one". They believe in freedom with responsibility and support flexibility in work, as long as it goes both ways. Zacco also encourages competence development, so that employees can stay up to date with changes in the industry and can continue to develop their skills. Zacco has more than 500 employees and has experts in all aspects of intellectual property law, including a large number of experienced Patent, Trademark and Design lawyers and attorneys and paralegals.

title: User Experience Researcher (Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**We have only scratched the surface.** 
 The online travel industry is an extremely dynamic and competitive space. Our aim is to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment.
   

  

**Work in the heart of Asia.** 
 This is an amazing opportunity if you’re looking for an exciting adventure abroad while expanding your international research capabilities. You get a chance to live in one of the most beautiful and most visited cities in the world!
   

  

**This position is open to worldwide candidates and we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
 UX Researchers own end-to-end planning, execution, analysis and reporting of research projects, and consistently achieve research outputs needed by Product teams to inform strategic decisions. The research findings of UX Researchers impact Agoda’s business success by informing Product teams regarding design or design process, end user experience, product direction, market strategy or similar.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Master Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, Social Science, or any related field
* 7+ years of relevant experience in consumer-facing business domains
* You are very comfortable with planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research
* Experience with Qualitative and user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.)
* Experience with Quantitative research (metrics, survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.)
* Experience in evaluating, negotiating, and working with external research vendors
* Be able to describe user problems and business opportunities to a variety of stakeholders by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data
* You are able to demonstrate critical thinking beyond business requests
* You are a great storyteller and communicator, able to speak fluently to business people, designers, engineers and other stakeholders (in English)
* You enjoy collaborative work in a dynamic, data-driven and creative environment


**Responsibilities:**
 General Role Expectations:
   

  

* Demonstrates critical thinking beyond explicit business requests
* Functions independently in all operational research tasks
* Leads core end-to-end research activities – including driving research objectives, hypotheses, methodology, execution, analysis, and communication


 Research Skills:
   

  

* Good judgement when evaluating research opportunities, e.g. importance, urgency, and impact for team
* Ability to reasonably challenge details of research requests, and propose solid research solutions
* Strong project execution with existing skills while constantly expanding his/her breadth and depth of abilities.
* Knowledge of approaches for both quantitative and qualitative research, effectively triangulating findings, methods, and theories with others.
* Application of tools and inspection methods to quantify the value and efficiency of research
* Ability to adopt and adapt well-established methods according to product/project situations, and innovate new methods in collaboration with more senior researchers
* Knowledge of or ability to quickly learn key software tools common in the field (e.g. for surveys, diary studies, analysis)
* Knowledge of data compliance and ethics in all of their activities


 Collaboration & Collaboration:
   

  

* Drives cross-discipline/department collaboration via research insights/activities.
* Collaborates efficiently with other researchers and other disciplines, with clear commitments in case of shared ownership.
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills; tailors communication style for different audiences, concise and to the point, open to taking input and feedback


 Research Community Contributions:
   

  

* Contributes to the research community in one or more ways – sharing work/ methodologies, coaching and/or mentoring other core or junior researchers, screening of Research candidates


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
   

  

**Skill** 
 - Digital Workplace Transformation
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.


**Required - Mandatory:**
* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –


 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
   

  

**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.


**Why Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: Product Manager Insurance
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
**Own and scale a core product with huge potential**
 We’re looking for a Product Manager to take full ownership of our Insurance product - one of Sambla Group’s key growth areas. You’ll report directly to the Head of Products and take lead in owning the roadmap, strategy and performance, with a focus on growing recurring revenue, improving retention, and building long-term customer relationships through relevant products and digital experiences.
   

  

 Insurance is already a high-performing product at Sambla Group, generating over 200 MSEK in annual revenue, and we’ve just migrated to a new platform to support the next phase of growth. You’ll step in at a pivotal moment, with a solid foundation in place and a clear mandate to scale, innovate and elevate the customer experience. We’re now strengthening the team around the product with more capacity in other areas of the company - and this is your opportunity to shape what comes next.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own and lead the insurance roadmap, strategy and KPIs
* Drive initiatives that increase monthly paying users, retention and lifetime value
* Build customer journeys that combine strong UX with partner alignment and compliance
* Work cross-functionally and help shape team processes that enable efficient delivery
* Contribute to Sambla Group’s broader product portfolio and expansion strategy


**What We’re Looking For**
* A driven doer with strong product instincts and a hands-on mindset
* Someone who thrives in a high-performing, fast-moving environment
* Data-informed, structured and user-focused mindset
* Strong communication skills
* Fluent in English (Nordic language is a plus)


**Why this role**
* High ownership and clear impact
* Strong team around you - with devs, analyst, QA/coordinator
* Strategic, yet hands-on
* Direct influence on a growing product and future expansion


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Technical Designer - ARC Raiders
description:
We are looking for a Technical Designer to join ARC Raiders game teams here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering ~100 developers.
   

  

 In this role you will be responsible for the technical design work by creating, implementing, and maintaining tools, systems, & other workflows as a bridge between design and code.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with the Design Director and other Designers of the project, as well as Production leadership helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Help design and prove new features by developing prototypes for the design team to experiment with
* Help identify technical pitfalls and challenges in our designs, offering possible solutions or alternatives
* Contribute tool and workflow improvement ideas, especially design tools
* Help design, balance, and tweak our more technical gameplay systems, for example activity spawning or loot distribution
* Work with other disciplines to help align design intent with non-design pipelines and tech


**We would love if you have**
* Around 5+ years of experience within technical design making games
* A good grasp of AAA PvP/PvE gameplay and systems design, including player psychology, UX design, and gameplay mechanics & dynamics
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience in scripting and blueprints
* Knowledge of the UnrealEngine-Angelscript plugin is a big plus, but not required
* Knowledge of programming languages such as C#, Lua, or Python
* A creative and curious mind
* A good knowledge or familiarity with other game making disciplines such as animation, UX, 3D Art, etc.
* A great creative collaborator in cross disciplinary groups
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.
 



  





 Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.
 



  





 Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.
 



  





 At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.
 



  





**WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS** 




 We’re building intelligent, intuitive features that make discovering the perfect book feel like magic. That means scaling:
 



  





 🤖AI librarian, our multi-agentic book recommender with chat interface
 



 📚 Content-based recommendations that understand who you are and what you love
 



 🔍 Semantic search, powered by language models and vector retrieval
 



  





 To bring these to life, we need someone who writes clean, production-ready Python, loves experimenting with real-world data, and wants to see their work impact millions of readers. This isn’t just about training models - it’s about designing systems that deliver them reliably, efficiently, and at scale.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO** 




 🟢 Ship ML-powered features to production with real user impact
 



 🟢 Build and optimize end-to-end ML pipelines for training, serving, and inference
 



 🟢 Develop recommendation models using book metadata, embeddings, and behavioral signals
 



 🟢 Contribute to our AI librarian's brain —integrating ranking, retrieval, and personalization
 



 🟢 Work closely with engineers, product, and data scientists in a tight feedback loop
 



 🟢 Integrate models into low-latency APIs and monitor their performance
 



 🟢 Ensure systems are robust, scalable, and tested—not just clever in theory
 



  





**OUR STACK** 
 🧰
 



**Languages:** 
 Python, SQL
 



**Cloud & MLOps:** 
 GCP (Vertex AI, BigQuery), Vertex AI Pipelines
 



**Search & Retrieval:** 
 Vertex AI Search, Matching Engine
 



**Infra & Observability:** 
 Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, GCP Monitoring
 



  





**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS** 




 🟣 3+ years of experience as an ML or Software Engineer working on ML systems
 



 🟣 Strong Python skills - your code is clean, maintainable, and production-ready
 



 🟣 Experience deploying models in real-world environments (not just notebooks)
 



 🟣 Hands-on experience with end-to-end ML pipelines (training, evaluation, serving)
 



 🟣 Experience with version control, testing, and CI/CD for ML models
 



 🟣 Understanding of model evaluation, A/B testing, and performance metrics
 



 🟣 Strong problem-solving and debugging skills
 



 🟣 Effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams
 



 🟣 Understanding of ML pipelines, APIs, and model serving at scale
 



 🟣 Familiarity with cloud-native tooling (bonus for GCP + Vertex AI)
 



 🟣 You’re collaborative, pragmatic, and care about impact more than ego
 



  





**BONUS IF YOU HAVE 🌟** 




 Experience building and shipping recommendation systems (collaborative filtering or content-based), semantic search, or chat interfaces
 



  





 Passionate about personalization, conversational UX, or storytelling
 



  





 Hands-on experience with natural language processing (NLU and NLG), LLMs and RAG
 



  





 Familiarity with GCP services, especially Vertex AI, BigQuery, and Cloud Storage
 



  





 You actually enjoy reading (not required, but you’ll fit right in)
 



  





 Hands-on experience with (multi-)agent systems)
 



  





  





 Come join a team that’s using machine learning to make the world a little wiser, happier, and more inspired - one book at a time.
 



  





**WORK ENVIRONMENT AND IMPORTANT DETAILS** 




 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
 



  





 Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.

title: CPO till ClearOn
description:
Vill du vara med och leda produktutvecklingen i ett dynamiskt företag som står inför spännande tillväxtmöjligheter? Vi söker en erfaren och strategisk ledare till rollen som CPO (Head of Product) till ClearOn.
   

  

 Som CPO kommer du att ansvara för att forma och genomföra bolagets produktvision och leda ett team bestående av produktchefer och produktägare. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i ClearOn:s fortsatta tillväxt och ingå i företagets ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att driva produktvisionen på ledningsnivå och samarbeta tätt med CEO och ledningsgruppen för att utveckla och förverkliga företagets strategi. Du är ansvarig för hela produktportföljen, inklusive affärsutveckling och innovation, med fokus på att säkerställa ClearOns kommersiella framgång och fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

 ClearOn:s kontor är beläget i Liljeholmen och du kommer rapportera till CEO.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**
* Definiera och genomföra en produktvision i linje med företagets mål och affärsstrategi.
* Ansvara för ClearOns produkter och tjänster samt deras P&L.
* Leda och coacha ett team av produktchefer och produktägare för att främja en kultur av innovation och samarbete.
* Ansvara för att produktvision och roadmap skall möta dagens och morgondagens behov.
* Säkerställa effektiv kommunikation mellan olika avdelningar och produktteamet.
* Hantera produktutvecklingsprocesser för att säkerställa högkvalitativ och tidsenlig leverans.


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom produktledning, varav minst 2 år med ledarskap över produktchefer.
* Starka ledarskapsförmågor och erfarenhet av att inspirera och motivera team i snabbrörliga tekniska miljöer.
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom produktutveckling, marknadsföring och djup förståelse för SaaS-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av datadriven produktutveckling, A/B-testning och användarundersökningar.
* Kunskap om agila metoder och SCRUM-ramverket.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom FMCG.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har förmåga att översätta marknadsbehov till strategiska produktplaner och balansera kortsiktiga och långsiktiga mål.
* Är lösningsorienterad, drivande och målinriktad med en stark förmåga att anpassa dig till förändringar.


**Om ClearOn**
 ClearOn är Sveriges marknadsledande partner för säljdrivande kampanjer både i butik och digital närvaro inom dagligvaru- och servicehandeln med över 50 års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Vi är en full servicepartner inom säljdrivande lösningar där vi erbjuder innovativa tekniska lösningar och interaktiva kampanjer som skapar engagemang och försäljning i butik.
   

  

 Vi arbetar utifrån ett 360 graders perspektiv och erbjuder strategisk rådgivning och analys och driver långsiktig tillväxt genom unika och konkurrenskraftiga erbjudanden och tjänster i strävan att nå vårt mål som en komplett partner för att förstå, aktivera och sammanföra varumärken med konsumenter.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar ClearOn med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.
   

  

 Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.
   

  

 #IT

title: SAP-konsult, Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Känner du dig nyfiken på nya utmaningar? Vill du jobba på en flexibel arbetsplats med spännande uppdrag inom SAP?
   

  

 Nu söker vi erfarna SAP-konsulter till vårt team i Stockholm, som är en del av vår nationella SAP Practice där vi jobbar tillsammans med SAP i fokus. Nu sker en renässans inom SAP med SAP S/4HANA, SAP Business Technology Platform, Embedded Analytics med mera. Det innebär att företag som använder SAP står inför helt nya utmaningar och möjligheter. Vill du vara med på denna resa?
   

  

 Välkommen till oss på CGI!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som SAP-konsult får du möjlighet att vara en viktig kugge i CGI:s leverans gentemot uppdragsgivare där du ingår i ett team med kunniga och erfarna kollegor. Här får du möjlighet att hjälpa våra kunder att effektivisera och utveckla sina affärsprocesser och systemlösningar med hjälp av de möjligheter SAP som affärssystem ger.
   

  

 Våra uppdrag finns inom till exempel ECC, CRM, S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors och User Experience. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta inom såväl implementationsprojekt, processförbättringar och förvaltningsuppdrag inom olika branscher så som Insurance, Retail och Manufacturing.
   

  

 Våra kunder befinner sig på olika stadier i sina resor mot S/4HANA. En del befinner sig redan i den nya tekniken, några har en pågående förändringsresa och andra har ännu inte tagit steget till den nya SAP-plattformen. Här kommer du spela en viktig roll i att guida våra kunder i deras förändringsresa.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som redan är SAP-konsult eller har arbetat som SAP key user, och i rollen deltagit i eller drivit utvecklings- eller förändringsprojekt. Om du inte redan har arbetat med S/4HANA är det viktigt att du är nyfiken på det och vill göra en kompetensresa.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har följande:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Svenska och engelska obehindrad i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet eller ett brinnande intresse för ett eller flera av följande områden:
   

  

* Masterdata
* Finance
* Plan
* Source
* Make
* Deliver
* Security
* Analytics
* Technology
* ABAP
* Business Tech Platform (BTP)
* Integration, SAP Cloud Platform Intergration (CPI)
* RPA
* Machine learning
* User Experience (Fiori, Neptune)


**Mer information om tjänsten**
 För den här rollen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Rollen som konsult innebär en omväxlande vardag där du behöver ha en förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete. För att framgångsrikt kunna lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställs inför söker vi dig med ett analytiskt tänk och kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. Du bör dessutom ha en affärsmässig inställning, ett stort eget driv och gilla utmaningar.
   

  

 CGI är ett av världens största oberoende tjänsteföretag inom IT och affärsprocesser och vi har ett nära samarbete med SAP som Guldpartner. CGI har även blivit utsedda till SAP Partner Of The Year de senaste två åren och är en av de största SAP-leverantörerna på den svenska marknaden.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vad bra! Sök till tjänsten redan nu då vi rekryterar löpande.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Junior IT-supporttekniker sökes för sommaruppdrag i Malmö!
description:
Är du i början av din IT-karriär och söker ett spännande uppdrag i sommar? Har du ett stort IT-intresse, en hjälpsam attityd och gillar att lösa problem? Vi söker nu juniora IT-supporttekniker som är **tillgängliga omgående** för **kortare sommaruppdrag** i **Malmö**!

#### **Om rollen:**


I rollen som IT-supporttekniker blir du en del av ett kunnigt team där du får möjlighet att utveckla dina kunskaper genom att stötta användare i deras IT-relaterade frågor. Du kommer främst att arbeta med **första linjens support** via telefon, mejl och fjärrstyrning – perfekt för dig som nyligen avslutat en IT-utbildning eller har viss erfarenhet inom support.

#### **Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**

* Ge praktisk support på plats i walk-in centret för mjukvaru-, hårdvaru- och kringutrustningsproblem
* Felsöka och lösa ärenden i ärendehanteringssystem enligt gällande SLA
* Samarbeta med andra IT-team vid eskaleringar och specialförfrågningar
* Dokumentera lösningar och bidra till kunskapsdatabasen
* Leverera en användarcentrerad och kvalitativ supportupplevelse

#### **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har avslutat en IT-utbildning eller har upp till 1 års erfarenhet av IT-support
* Är serviceinriktad, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Är tillgänglig omgående och kan arbeta under sommaren

#### **Övrig information:**

* **Ort:** Malmö
* **Start:** Omgående

#### **Ansökan:**


Skicka gärna in ditt CV redan idag! Urval sker löpande så vänta inte för länge. Vid frågor, kontakta **maria@linden-it.se**.

title: IT-specialist Citrix/Virtual Client till Atea Operations
description:
Är du en lagspelare som vill bli en del av landslaget? Lockas du av att utmanas, vara en del av ett erfaret team med kollegor från hela landet? Just nu söker vi på Atea Operations dig som vill jobba som IT-specialist med fokus på Citrix/Virtual Client. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och som människa. Vi värdesätter dina unika styrkor och erfarenheter, och tillsammans gör vi skillnad varje dag. Tillsammans bygger vi Sverige med it.


**Din roll**
------------



Vi söker dig som är specialist, eller en aspirerande stjärna inom området. Du kommer ingå i vår nationella tjänsteleverans där du får arbeta med drift, förvaltning, förbättringsarbete och spännande projekt inom Citrix och Virtual Client Operations.
