* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.


Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
company_description: Our team mirrors our global audience: we are a diverse team of people from over 30 different countries that get together everyday.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Are you a Data Scientist? If so, Greenely is looking for an exceptional individual to join our team! Greenely is the energy consumer platform dedicated to helping families navigate the increasingly complex world of electricity. Our mission is to reduce your energy bill to zero, not merely by optimizing home energy usage, but by enabling you to generate virtual power. Our mission is to enable every home to play a vital role in the energy transition in Europe.

 **What you’ll be doing :**

* Work cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Business teams to identify impactful problems and solve them with data.
* Analyze large, complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic decision-making.
* Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions to improve our products and operations.
* Design and interpret A/B tests and experiments.
* Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations for stakeholders.
* Help shape our data culture and contribute to improving our data tools and infrastructure.
  

**What you'll need to succeed :**

* 2+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or in a similar analytical role.
* Proficiency in Python (Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.) and SQL.
* Solid understanding of statistics, experimental design, and machine learning techniques.
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar).
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate complex ideas clearly.
* A team player who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

**We'll be really impressed if you :**

* Have experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or Azure).
* Have knowledge of dbt, Airflow, or other data engineering tools.
* Familiarity with tools like Jupyter, Git, Docker.

  


**What we can offer you** ‍ **:**

  

* *Flexibility*: Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely one day a week while collaborating in our vibrant Stockholm office for the rest, conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* *Growth*: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* *Influence and Impact*: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* *Innovative Environment*: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.

 **About Greenely**

  

Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!

  

WE ARE **bold and push the limit.**

WE BELIEVE THAT **f****ast is better than slow.**

WE **t****hink like owners.**

WE **lead with knowledge.**

 *If you have questions or concerns, please contact XXX. We do not accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. Please note that we have carefully selected recruitment agencies for this opening and kindly request that other agencies refrain from contacting us regarding this position. Thank you for your understanding.*

title: Head of Business Development
description:
Northmill Bank is a challenger bank at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience, **digital yet personal**.


Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 200 employees in 3 countries, 4 000 business clients and 600 000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.

  

Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!

**About the role**


We are looking for someone to take on a broad business development role. You will focus on making our current business stronger - improving things like pricing, packaging, customer journeys, and product distribution - while also driving growth through new revenue opportunities, strategic partnerships, and market expansion, including M&A.  

  

This job isn’t just about strategy. You’ll also make things happen. That means leading projects, working with teams across the bank, and making sure good ideas actually turn into results. Over time, you’ll also help build and lead a team.

  

You’ll be working directly with the Chief Commercial Officer and will have a lot of visibility in the organization.

**What you'll work on**

* Make our existing products and business stronger by improving pricing, packaging, journeys, and how we reach customers
* Identify and evaluate new business ideas - new markets, new products, or M&A opportunities
* Take ideas from analysis to execution. Build business cases, get buy-in, and drive delivery
* Work with people from Product, Marketing, Sales, Legal, and Risk to make sure initiatives are well-coordinated
* Over time, hire and manage people as the business development team grows

**What we're looking for**

* 3–5 years of experience from a top-tier strategy consulting firm, investment banking, or a similar role with strong exposure to strategy and execution
* Strong analytical skills and comfort with Excel and PowerPoint
* Experience leading structured projects
* Curious, clear-thinking, and comfortable with change
* Fluent in English. Swedish is a plus but not required
* Experience from fintech, banking, or M&A is a bonus

**What we offer**

  

* A fantastic office in a prime Stockholm location with great spaces and views
* An independent role with the opportunity to make a real impact
* Great opportunities for professional development
* Health - 5 000 kr health care allowance
* Conference abroad every other year
* Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday
* Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office

**Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**  

  

**Please note:***As we’re approaching the summer holidays, we will start the recruitment process in August. Applications are reviewed continuously, and we appreciate your patience in the meantime. Have a great summer!*

title: Junior Data Scientist
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**

*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*

  

We are seeking a **Junior Data Scientist** with a technical background to join our growing Analytics Data Science team. You will collaborate with talented data scientists and partner with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Distribution, as well as new business areas, to deliver data-driven insights and impactful solutions across the organization. As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in providing value to various departments.


At Arrive, we leverage a modern data stack, including AWS, Snowflake, and DBT, to ensure our data processes are efficient and scalable. Our goal is to empower teams with self-service analytics through tools like Looker and Streamlit.


Some of the areas we are currently focusing on or planning to explore include supporting sales by generating and optimizing leads to attract more users to our platform, finding fraudulent accounts, and providing tools and insights to our organization to take the next best action.


You will play a key role in advancing Arrive’s data capabilities, ensuring that data insights are effectively integrated into decision-making processes across the organization

**Key responsibilities:**

* Work on end-to-end data science projects, from problem definition to production deployment.
* Working with cross-functional teams on joint projects.
* Take ownership and ensure the ongoing maintenance of developed solutions.
* Promote data literacy throughout the organization by mentoring and educating non-data professionals to build analytical skills.
* Continuously learn about the newest data science trends and technologies.
* Transform intricate data insights into practical business strategies, contributing to strategic discussions.

**What you’ll bring to the team**

* Up to 3 years experience working as a Data Scientist or a PhD in a relevant field (e.g. Mobility or Machine Learning related).
* Technical:
	+ Experience with Python and relevant data science libraries.
	+ Proficiency in working with databases and SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
	+ Knowledge of best practices in regards to software development.
	+ Experience working with cloud environments is a plus (e.g. AWS, GCP, Snowflake, Airflow).
* Soft skills:
	+ Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to dive deep into data to uncover insights.
	+ Prioritize by impact and be self driven.
	+ Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.
	+ Being communicative**,** capable of articulating complex findings clearly to diverse audiences.
* English is our business language, so you should be comfortable speaking and writing in English at a professional level.

**Our way of working**


Since we have team members that are located in different countries, we work remotely first. However, our Stockholm-based team members aim to meet in the office once or twice a week.

 **What We Offer**

* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: virtual onboarding sessions to connect with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Continuous learning: access to an online learning platform to support your growth.
* A multicultural environment: collaborate with colleagues from around the globe.

**About us**  

*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*

title: Head of Operations
description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience,
 **digital yet personal** 
 .
   

  

 Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 200 employees in 3 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.
   

  

 Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Head of Operations, you will report to the Chief Product Technology & Operations Officer and play a key role in driving operational excellence across the business. You’ll lead the continuous improvement of processes and routines across key departments such as: Customer Center, AML & Fraud Prevention, Client Onboarding (B2B & B2C) and Instore Payments (Point-of-Sale)
   

  

 You’ll be responsible for developing scalable processes, aligning cross-functional teams, and ensuring operational efficiency as we grow. This is a critical role that blends strategy with execution, and people leadership with data-driven decision-making.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Analyze and improve processes across customer-facing and back-office functions.
* Ensure compliance, quality, and risk mitigation across AML, fraud, and onboarding.
* Work closely with Product, Tech, and Compliance to align operations with business needs.
* Drive automation, digitalization, and continuous improvement initiatives.
* Lead, coach, and develop teams across operational departments.
* Define and track KPIs to monitor performance and identify opportunities.
* Act as a key partner to the CPTO and leadership team in shaping the operational strategy.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in a senior operations leadership role, ideally in fintech, banking, management consulting or another regulated industry.
* Strong understanding of operational processes within customer service, onboarding, AML/fraud, or payments.
* Data-driven mindset with a passion for efficiency and structure.
* Experienced in scaling teams and building cross-functional alignment.
* Natural leader and communicator who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.


**Fun Facts**
* Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
* Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”.
* Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
* Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
* Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
* Stockholm's most beautiful office space that the city has to offer, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.


**Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**
 Northmill is a tech company with a banking license aiming to improve financial life, offer merchants smart solutions and erase the borders between in-store and online.
   

  

 Northmill creates a more personal and relevant experience for people and companies, helping more than 2,500 merchants and 600,000 end users.
   

  

**Saved for users** 
 31 MSEK
   

  

**Trustpilot** 
 4.6 of 5
   

  

**Cloud** 
 100 %
   

  

**End users** 
 600 000

title: Insights Analyst
description:
Universum is a global leader in employer branding insights and research. For over 35 years, we have been helping the world’s top employers understand, attract, and retain talent.
 



  





  





**Job Description:** 




  





 We are looking for an Insights Analyst with strong technical skills in data analysis, visualization, and BI tools. In this role, you will work at the intersection of data, technology, and research — with key responsibilities across three core areas:
 



  





 1️⃣ Deep data analysis of survey results and large datasets
 



 2️⃣ Development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for clients
 



 3️⃣ Coordination of research projects from data collection through to client delivery
 



  





 As part of the Insights Management team, you will play a critical role in ensuring that data is accurate, well-structured, and translated into insights that drive real value for our clients. The ideal candidate combines technical proficiency (Tableau, SQL, BI tools) with strong project coordination and a passion for delivering high-quality insights.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Conduct deep analysis of quantitative survey data to uncover key trends and insights
* Design, build, and maintain Tableau dashboards and other BI visualizations for internal and external audiences
* Coordinate research project workflows from initial data collection through to final client delivery
* Collaborate with internal teams (research, programming, data, client service) and external stakeholders to ensure data quality and project success
* Prepare, clean, and structure data for analysis and visualization
* Optimize and automate reporting processes where possible
* Support innovation in data analysis, visualization techniques, and research methodologies
* Develop clear, client-ready visual outputs that communicate complex data simply and effectively
* Stay current with trends in BI, data visualization, and employer branding



  





  





**Requirements** 



* Proven experience in data analysis and visualization — ideally in market research, insights, or a related field
* Advanced proficiency in Tableau — must be able to develop dashboards from scratch
* Strong SQL skills — able to query, manipulate, and structure data
* Experience with additional BI tools (Power BI, Looker Studio) is a plus
* Proficiency in Excel; knowledge of SPSS, R, or Python is an advantage
* Familiarity with survey data and market research methodologies
* Strong organizational skills — able to manage multiple projects and deadlines
* Experience coordinating research projects and working with diverse stakeholders
* Excellent attention to detail and commitment to data quality
* Ability to synthesize complex data into clear, actionable insights
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Proactive mindset with an interest in continuous learning and innovation



  





  





**Qualifications** 



* 3+ years of hands-on experience in a data or business analyst role with a strong focus on Tableau dashboard development.
* Strong understanding of data visualization principles and experience working with survey and research data.
* Proven expertise with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud – including advanced dashboard creation and performance tuning.
* Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms, such as Snowflake.
* Knowledge in SQL – able to write queries to extract, manipulate, and validate large datasets.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to balance technical and non-technical stakeholder needs.
* Knowledge of employer branding, HR analytics, or market research is a plus.



  





  





**What We Offer** 



* Be part of an international, collaborative team of research professionals
* Flexible, supportive work environment with opportunities for growth
* Hybrid work arrangements
* 30 days of paid vacation + 1 paid wellness day every 6 months
* Competitive pension solution
* Health allowance



  





 The selection process is ongoing and we are therefore looking forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We encourage people with different backgrounds, identities, and ethnicities to apply.

title: Ubuntu Sales Engineer (Entry-Level)
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring an
 **Ubuntu Pro Sales Engineer** 
 to help global companies embrace the latest and greatest Linux and open source applications. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu Pro, OpenStack and Canonical Microcloud, Kubernetes and a wide range of associated technology. The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.
   

  

 This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 The Ubuntu Pro Sales Engineer is a key player in our efforts to facilitate and drive the adoption of Ubuntu Pro in the very large Ubuntu enterprise user base.
   

  

* Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
* Identify customer challenges with open source and articulate how Ubuntu Pro could help solve them
* Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro to prospective and current clients
* Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
* Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
* Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
* Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
* Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
* Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
* Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
* Intermediate level Python programming skills
* Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
* The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
* Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
* Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
* Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Client Executive, The Nordics
description:
**About Northern Trust**
 Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
   

  

 Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
   

  

**Role/Department**
 The Client Executive role will have overall responsibility for managing a portfolio of franchise clients in the Nordic region that receive a broad range of services from Northern Trust. The successful candidate will act as the Senior Relationship Manager, ensuring the smooth delivery of our services and development of client relationships and revenues.
   

  

**The Key Responsibilities Of The Role Include**
*Relationship Management*
* Ownership of client growth, profitability, loyalty, satisfaction
* Establish ties with key decision-makers
* Develop understanding of client’s strategic goals and identify ways in which Northern Trust can financially optimise both new and existing relationships
* Drive initiatives for client driven product development requirements; working closely with the various product teams
* Responsible for overall client satisfaction levels at a strategic level and ensure relevant key performance indicators are in place to meet client goals
* Establish and maintain relationship plans.


*Sales and Profitability Management*
* Develop, maintain and execute client coverage plans, ensuring effective engagement with all key stakeholders within  client organisations
* Maintain comprehensive understanding of key industry trends in order to facilitate strategic engagement with clients, developing a consultative and collaborative approach in helping them to navigate change in the investment and regulatory landscape
* Ensure long-term profitability of client relationship
* Cross-selling of additional products
* Pricing of new and additional business opportunities


*Risk Management*
* Identify, document and manage client related risk issues
* Effective negotiation of contracts
* Manage service delivery with awareness of internal and external compliance requirement
* Awareness of Product/Counterparty credit/Client credit risk
* Ensure adherence and understanding of Northern Trust KYC/AML procedures


*Client Service Management*
* Overall responsibility for service delivery. This is achieved by working closely with our client service and operational teams
* Project oversight


**Skills/Qualifications**
 The successful candidate will benefit from having:
   

  

* Experience in major financial services business
* Several years in a custodian bank, an asset management firm, the securities market or a similar organization within the industry.
* Ability to establish commercial relationships with Executive level Client Stakeholders
* Experience of strategic lead for business development
* Experience of increasing revenue through effective client relationships
* Thorough knowledge of asset servicing, products, investments and business segment specific issues
* Leadership and organizational skills
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Proven ability to influence internally and externally at the highest level
* Good networking contacts and abilities
* Fluent English and a minimum of one Scandinavian language


**Working With Us**
 As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
   

  

 Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
   

  

 We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
   

  

**Reasonable accommodation**
 Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.
   

  

 We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
   

  

 Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

title: Virtual Account Executive-Sweden
description:
**Extreme Networks Named to Computerworld’s 2023 List of Best Places to Work in IT!**
 Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before and with double digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver better outcomes on scale, than Extreme.
   

  

 We believe in “walking the walk” of our strong core values which enable us to successfully advance together. Diversity and Inclusion is a vital part of our values and beliefs, and we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive.
   

  

 Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East.
   

  

 Virtual Account Executive is sales professional focused on acquiring and developing business within assigned territories and verticals, while looking for new logo prospects and developing existing accounts. Candidates will effectively be spending 70% of the time on active selling and 30% on supporting tasks such as network quotes, agreeing conditions with partners and other tasks related to sales.
   

  

**Virtual Sales Tasks**
* Acquire new logo business, build strong pipeline.
* Actively seeks out and develops new customers, new opportunities.
* Proactively contacting the existing clients to maximize business potential – active upsell/cross sell .
* Engaging with new leads provided by Operations Team, maximize MQL conversion into real opportunity
* Generate new sales leads and opportunities
* Acquisition and developing own customer portfolio – direct touch with end users is requirement
* Provide consistent interaction with existing customers – upsell/cross sell initiatives
* Ensures that information about new products, services, and operational changes are communicated to customers on a timely basis
* Maintain and builds account relationships.
* Represents the Company at industry trade shows and conferences – travel requirements is a must


**Other Tasks**
* Manage the day to day client meetings.
* Maintains all information about customers, including all contact information and call reports, accurately and timely in CRM (Salesforce).
* Managing the jobs from quotation stage to booking in line with the client expectations and communicating effectively any service issues.
* Manage and follow-up on quotes.
* Internal liaison with the operations team assisting with quotations and service information.
* Reporting activities to the country manager
* Strong Swedish language skills

title: Data Engineer - Personalization
description:
At Spotify, we’re on a mission to unlock the potential of human creativity by connecting millions of artists with billions of fans around the world. The Search product area is central to that mission—reinventing how users find and connect with content in new and relevant ways.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join a squad passionate about delivering pioneering search experiences powered by Machine Learning (ML) and Large Language Models (LLMs). In this role, you’ll help craft the team’s data strategy and build the systems that power smarter, more intuitive discovery on Spotify.
   

  

 You’ll work alongside a dedicated mix of ML and Backend Engineers to tackle some of Spotify’s most exciting challenges in retrieval, ranking, and personalization. If you're excited by data systems, ML-powered products, and the opportunity to impact how millions of people explore audio content—this is the role for you.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable data pipelines that support advanced search capabilities.
* Partner closely with ML and Backend Engineers to enable features like organic search retrieval and personalized recommendations.
* Continuously assess and improve the health of the team’s data stack, driving efforts to increase reliability, observability, and efficiency.
* Advocate for modern data engineering practices—e.g., data quality, monitoring, reproducibility—across the squad and broader org.
* Contribute to technical direction and strategic decisions around how we handle and use data for ML.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have proven experience in data engineering, including creating reliable, efficient, and scalable data pipelines using data processing frameworks such as Scio, DataFlow, Beam or equivalent.
* You are comfortable working with large datasets using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
* You are knowledgeable in cloud-based environments, preferably with an understanding of Google Cloud Platform.
* You are familiar with A/B testing frameworks and experimentation platforms.
* You’re eager to collaborate with ML teams and understand the unique demands of supporting ML models in production.
* You bring a mentor attitude and enjoy helping peers (even from other subject areas) grow their data proficiency.
* You take initiative in improving data systems and practices, and can drive improvements independently when needed.
* You prioritize data quality, monitoring, and clarity, and understand their importance in reliable ML systems.
* You thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments where learning and iteration are part of the culture.
* You’re passionate about search, discovery, and the challenge of helping users find the right content at the right time.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within Sweden, as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the CET time zone for collaboration.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Director Consulting Services – Utilities, Stockholm
description:
As a Director Consulting Services, you will play a crucial role by focusing on our most valuable assets: our clients, our business, and our employees. You will work with multiple existing clients within the Utilities sector, while also being responsible for developing existing and new business opportunities. You will be an essential part of CGI's continued growth journey, with significant opportunities to influence both your own and your team's career development. Additionally, you will be a member of the management team within the unit focusing on Utilities sector, where you will actively contribute to the operational, tactical, and strategic development of the unit.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with strong experience in Service Delivery, Business Consulting and System development, who also has a strong passion for business development. We believe that you have an extensive network within IT and industry sectors and are experienced in engaging with clients to understand their challenges and opportunities in both digitalization and business development.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As a Director Consulting Services, you will be responsible for the group's growth, financial performance, capacity planning, and competency development. You will have profit and budget responsibility for your clients and the employees within your team.
   

  

 One of your key challenges will be to drive aggressive growth targets for the group, with a focus on the following areas:
   

  

* Business Development – Act as a strategic advisor to our clients, aiming to deepen partnerships and open new business opportunities.
* Leadership – Lead, develop, and motivate your employees to achieve both their personal goals and CGI’s objectives. Your team will consist of approximately 15–20 employees.
* Recruitment – Attract, retain, and recruit new talent to expand your team.
* Operational Management – Ensure the achievement of revenue, profitability, and growth targets in alignment with the team's roadmap and growth plan.
* Industry Expertise – Stay updated on developments within System Development and the Utility sector to maintain a leading advisory role within CGI in these areas.
* Management Team Collaboration – Actively participate in the management team to develop the unit and maintain our commitment to being a world-class team.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We are looking for someone who enjoys developing both business and client relationships. You are driven by identifying new business opportunities that create value for clients. Your experience in the Energy, Oil, Gas utilities sector, Business Consulting, and IT enables you to easily understand technology and discuss client needs, linking them to our services and strategic competency development for our employees.
   

  

 As a person, you are highly motivated and thrives in a progressive and change-driven environment. You are a leader who motivates and engages your employees, with a positive and communicative attitude, as well as the determination to develop both the business and your team.
   

  

 We offer you a challenging and rewarding role, where you will have the responsibility to drive the growth of your team and unit, alongside a fantastic group of colleagues and leaders.
   

  

**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline. Please feel free to send your inquiries to: Bodil Oscarsson, bodil.oscarsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Solution Advisor Senior Specialist, Sweden
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

 We are looking for a talented Solution Advisor to join our Digital Supply Chain Team in EMEA, with a strong background in Supply Chain Planning. Experience working within Supply Chain and of delivering projects will really help you to understand our customers requirements and get them excited about the value SAP solutions can bring to them!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 In this role you will bring well-developed solution and business process knowledge to customers by demonstrating a compelling vision of the future with SAP & partner solutions. You will identify, qualify, and demonstrate how SAP can provide the best solution to achieve customers business outcomes. A key part of this role is the ability to deliver memorable customer experiences with stories that differentiate with business outcomes. The role encompasses the full lifecycle of customer engagement, from supporting business development activities through to supporting renewals for existing customers.
   

  

**Account Team Engagement**
* Engage with customers early in the sales cycle by matching customer needs and vision to SAP solutions and qualifying the opportunity against a probability of success.
* Manage the business process discovery to provide a foundation for the solution recommendations and support the business capability mapping, technical discoveries, and the case for change.
* Support new sales and adoption by providing solution-specific expertise and competitive differentiation.
* Provide expertise to the account team and to the development of the account strategy.
* Contribute to creation of overall theme and competitive differentiation (value wedges) and execute dry runs.
* Engage customers through impactful storytelling.
* Provide answers to customer / internal SAP team inquiries concerning solution topics focusing on driving customer success and business outcomes.
* Embrace consistent messaging and employ digital assets in all customer engagements, including recorded demos, presentations, microsites, and other reusable content.


**Customer Lifecycle Engagement**
* Effectively transition the deal to on-boarding teams / partners
* Drive adoption by continuing to sell the vision and impact of SAP's solutions post-selection.
* Provide expertise through the customers' successful deployments and realization of value, as required.
* Build knowledge across the customer lifecycle.
* Expand the SAP footprint by showing how other SAP solutions can be leveraged to address other areas of their business.


**What You Bring**
 Your focus and experience should be in the Supply Chain Planning area. In particular, extensive experience with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) or SAP Advanced Planning Optimizer (APO) is essential. Knowledge of competitor solutions would also be advantageous.
   

  

 In particular, we will be looking for people that can demonstrate the following:
   

  

* Extensive experience with SAP Integrated Business Planning or SAP APO
* Good understanding of SAP’s overall portfolio, especially other Digital Supply Chain solutions
* Good knowledge of the competition in the SCM Planning process area and the corresponding SAP solutions (IBP, APO, PP/DS)
* Detailed knowledge of the supply chain environment, especially planning processes and relationships with wider business processes
* Experience of implementing supply chain planning solutions
* Experience in value-based selling, value engineering
* Confidence presenting at C-level and enthusiasm for new and innovative solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills as well as experience with innovative presentation elements (e.g. Prezi, video, storytelling, etc.)
* Professional experience in presales, consulting and/or value engineering


 As well as this, you will also be great at:
   

  

* Building a strong network and relationships with colleagues and customers
* Priotising and managing your time effectively
* Continuously learning and developing to enhance and widen your domain expertise
* Being part of the wider SAP team, contributing to our Solution Hubs and helping others to develop


**Meet the Team**
 Working within the EMEA Digital Supply Chain team, you will be working alongside a diverse team covering the entire supply chain portfolio. As a key part of the Nordics market unit, you will also work closely with one of the largest market units within SAP, and therefore some of our largest customers, contributing significantly to the growth of SAP and toward it’s cloud transformation.
   

  

**#SAPCSCareers**
**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 423722 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .
   

  

**Job Segment:** 
 Supply Chain, ERP, Cloud, Pre-Sales, Supply, Operations, Technology, Sales

title: Konsultchef - CGI Public & Defense
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 CGI växer och söker nu förstärkning av en konsultchef till vår framgångsrika enhet för offentlig sektor i Stockholmsområdet! Som konsultchef på CGI spelar du en nyckelroll i att utveckla våra kunder, team och kompetenser. CGI:s framgångsrika ”Proximity model” innebär att du som konsultchef på CGI är kundansvarig, ledare och expert – det betyder att du är geografiskt nära både dina kunder och konsulter.
   

  

 Som Director Consulting Services (konsultchef) inom CGI Public & Defense blir du en del av vår ledargrupp som sträcker sig från Stockholm till Värmland.". Vi har en öppen och generös företagskultur och att dela med sig av sin kunskap är en förutsättning för att vi tillsammans ska lyckas med att utveckla vår verksamhet. Vi som arbetar här är drivna och motiverade och för oss är balans i livet en självklarhet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Du kommer att ha övergripande leveransansvar för uppdrag hos dina kunder samt säkerställa att vi levererar med hög kvalitet. Du agerar naturligt som det ”centrala ankaret” i leveranserna mot dina kunder.
   

  

 Genom förståelse för kundernas behov kommer du att aktivt arbeta med sälj- och affärsmöjligheter. Som ledare motiverar och engagerar du dina medarbetare och som kollega bidrar du till vårt team genom din positiva energi och ett lösningsorienterat sinne.
   

  

 Som ledare kommer du att, tillsammans med andra konsultchefer, ha ansvar för affärer hos dina kunder, tillväxt, kompetensutveckling och beläggning. Vidare kommer du att ha resultat- och budgetansvar för dina kunder och även genom proaktivitet leda affärsutvecklingen. En framgångsrik konsultchef på CGI jobbar runt 50% av tiden som expert i fakturerande uppdrag hos kund.
   

  

**I rollen som Director Consulting Services kommer du att arbeta med följande områden:**
* Affärsutveckling – utveckla kundrelationer och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter.
* Ledarskap – coacha ett team på 15–20 personer och stödja deras utveckling.
* Rekrytering – attrahera och anställa nya konsulter tillsammans med vårt TA-team.
* Operativt ansvar – budget, tillväxtmål, beläggning och lönsamhet.
* Kundarbete – driva uppdrag hos kund cirka 50 % av tiden.
* Ledningsgruppsarbete – bidra aktivt till utvecklingen av hela enheten.
* Branschinsikt – håll dig uppdaterad inom offentlig sektor och teknik.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av kundansvar och har ett starkt sinne för att driva affär hos våra kunder. Du brinner för ett proaktivt ledarskaps-och affärsansvar. Vi tror att du har ett brett nätverk inom offentlig sektor och IT-branschen och är van att möta kunder och förstå deras verksamheter, utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha god erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor samt förståelse för hur inköpsprocesserna fungerar hos offentlig sektor i Sverige. Vi tycker att det är viktigt att du är affärsmässig och har förmågan att se kundnyttan. Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av en ledande roll med medarbetar- samt resultatansvar. Din erfarenhet inom IT-området gör att du har lätt för att förstå tekniken och att diskutera kundbehov, som du sedan kopplar till våra tjänster, samt strategisk kompetensutveckling med medarbetare.
   

  

 Du är drivande som person och stimuleras av förändringsarbete; du är en transformativ ledare som motiverar och engagerar dina medarbetare, du har en positiv/kommunikativ läggning och viljestyrka att utveckla såväl verksamhet som medarbetare. Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal som väl i skrift.
   

  

 Du erbjuds ett utmanande och stimulerande arbete med ansvar att driva gruppen – och enhetens utveckling framåt, tillsammans med ett fantastiskt gäng medarbetare och ledare. Vi arbetar löpande med urval så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Director Consulting Services - System development team Manufacturing, Stockholm
description:
As a Consulting Manager, you will play a crucial role by focusing on our most important assets: our clients, our business, and our employees. You will work with multiple existing clients within the Manufacturing sector while also being responsible for developing new business
   

  

 opportunities. You will be an essential part of CGI's continued growth journey, with significant opportunities to influence both your own and your employees' careers. Additionally, you will be part of the management team for the unit focusing on Manufacturing, where you will actively contribute to operational, tactical, and strategic development.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with strong experience in System Development and Service Delivery, who also has a strong passion for business development. We believe that you have an extensive network within IT and industry sectors and are experienced in engaging with clients to understand their challenges and opportunities in both digitalization and business development.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As a Director of Consulting Services, you will be responsible for the growth, financial performance, resource utilization, and competence development of your team. You will have profit and budget responsibility for your clients and team members.
   

  

 Your key challenge will be driving aggressive growth for the team, with a focus on the following areas:
   

  

* Business Development – Act as a strategic advisor to our clients, aiming to deepen partnerships and open new business opportunities.
* Leadership – Lead, develop, and motivate your employees to achieve both their personal goals and CGI’s objectives. Your team will consist of approximately 15–20 employees.
* Recruitment – Attract, retain, and recruit new talent to expand your team.
* Operational Excellence – Ensure the achievement of revenue, profitability, and growth targets in alignment with the team's roadmap and growth plan.
* Industry Expertise – Stay updated on developments within System Development and the Manufacturing sector to maintain a leading advisory role within CGI in these areas.
* Management Team Collaboration – Actively participate in the management team to develop the unit and maintain our commitment to being a world-class team.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We are looking for someone who enjoys developing both business and client relationships. You are driven by identifying new business opportunities that create value for clients. Your experience in Manufacturing and IT enables you to easily understand technology and discuss client needs, linking them to our services and strategic competency development for our employees.
   

  

 As a person, you are proactive and thrive in driving progress and change. You are a motivational leader who engages your employees, has a positive and communicative approach, and a strong determination to develop both the business and your team members. You probably have a technical background and proven experience in consulting or team leadership within systems development.
   

  

 We offer a challenging and stimulating role where you will drive the growth and development of your team and the unit, alongside an amazing group of colleagues and leaders.
   

  

**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline.
   

  

 For any questions, please contact: henrik.sjostedt@cgi.com
   

  

****About CGI****
 CGI is leading the digitalization of Sweden and is a global leader in transforming innovation, information, and technology. With deep industry knowledge and an understanding of client challenges, we provide insights to drive sustainable results. We operate in 40 countries with 90,000 employees globally. In Sweden, we have approximately 4,000 employees across 30 locations, with headquarters in Stockholm.
   

  

 Learn more about CGI at: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Vill du använda din kompetens inom Salesforce för att göra skillnad? Som Salesforce-administratör hos Läkare Utan Gränser använder du din tekniska kompetens för att stärka världens största medicinska humanitära organisation, och blir samtidigt en nyckelspelare i vår satsning på data-driven insamling och kommunikation.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du blir den tredje länken i vårt Salesforce team (admin, support, produktägare) och blir central i vårt AI-arbete när du vidareutvecklar integrationsplattformen, samtidigt som du arbetar tätt med IT och webbkollegor. Plattformen är stabil efter en stor migrering, men nu tar vi nästa steg: att förena historisk CRM data med dagens Salesforce-data och att bredda användningen av moduler som Marketing Cloud. Rollen kombinerar operativ support med strategisk utveckling och nära samarbete med en extern partner för kodtunga leveranser.
 



  





**Dina främsta arbetsuppgifter** 



* Hantera 1st & 2nd line-ärenden för ~40 Salesforce-användare
* Konfigurera fält, layouter, validerings­regler, Flow-automationer och formulär
* Bygga rapporter, dashboards och datamodeller för ökad insikt
* Delta i dataprojekt som samlar äldre CRM-data och ny Salesforce-data
* Kravställa och kvalitetssäkra arbete från extern utvecklings­partner
* Coacha och stötta vår Salesforce-supportkollega



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 



* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som Salesforce-administratör
* Vana vid Scrum eller annan agil metodik
* Goda kunskaper i Flow Builder, rapport-/dashboard-skapande och datamigrering
* Flytande engelska i tal och skrift
* Engagemang för humanitära värden och vilja att göra skillnad med teknik



  





**Det är värdefullt om du har** 



* Certifieringar inom Salesforce eller Scrum, erfarenhet av Marketing Cloud eller andra CRM-system
* Tidigare arbete i ideell sektor
* Svenska språkkunskaper



  





**Den sociala arbetsmiljön på Läkare utan Gränser** 




 Som medarbetare på Läkare Utan Gränser Sverige kommer du att bidra till att människor får sjukvård och humanitär hjälp. Vi arbetar i en internationell, informell och välkomnande arbetsmiljö. Gemensamt för alla medarbetare är ett starkt engagemang och driv för att nå Läkare Utan Gränsers mål, att lindra nöd och rädda liv där behoven är som störst. Vi är en värderingsstyrd organisation med humanitärt fokus och det påverkar dig oavsett om du är volontär, arbetar på kontoret eller i projekt utomlands. Vi jobbar i team, vilket förutsätter att alla tar sitt ansvar, litar på varandras kompetenser, samt ger och tar emot feedback så att alla kan utvecklas. Vi har en lättsam stämning där ingen är rädd för att hugga i när det behövs. Du ska känna dig respekterad hos oss, oavsett vem du är. Hos oss uppmuntras du till att ta egna initiativ och därmed att utveckla både dig själv och verksamheten. För att kunna lindra nöd och rädda liv är det viktigt med kommunikation, både internt mellan kontoret och våra projekt och externt från oss till omvärlden.
 



  





**Anställningsvillkor** 




 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning (med 6 månaders provanställning)
 



 Önskat tillträde: Snarast möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
 



 Arbetstid: Vi tillämpar heltid på 37,5-timmarsvecka
 



 Lön: 36 474 kr/månaden (om du uppfyller kravet på 3 års erfarenhet) Fast lön enligt Läkare Utan Gränsers lönepolicy. Tidigare relevant dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet, utöver kravet för rollen, ger ytterligare påslag(beroende på längd av erfarenhet, upp till max totalt 8 års erfarenhet och 7,5 %)
 



 Förmåner: Tjänstepension, hälsoförsäkring, livförsäkring, arbetsskadeförsäkring, reseförsäkring, friskvårdsbidrag (upp till 3 000 kr/år) samt en friskvårdstimme i veckan.
 



 Ingen karensdag samt 100 % ersättning dag 2-14 av sjukdom.
 



 Semester: 30 dagar/år + 3,5 extra semesterdagar för alla (vilka varierar från år till år)
 



 Som medarbetare med Läkare Utan Gränser omfattas du av kollektivavtal mellan arbetsgivarorganisationen Fremia och fackförbunden Unionen samt Akademikerförbunden.
 



 Flexibel arbetspolicy som möjliggör att anställda också delvis kan arbeta hemifrån, men majoriteten av tiden tillbringas på vårt kontor i Årstadal/Liljeholmen.
 



  





 Urval sker löpande, skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag. Sista ansökningsdag är 18 juli men rollen kan komma att tillsättas redan innan sista ansökningsdag. Sök med CV och i stället för att skicka ett personligt brev ber vi dig att svara på frågorna om motivation till Läkare Utan Gränser via vårt rekryteringssystem (vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-mail enligt GDPR). Läkare Utan Gränser värderar mångfald högt och strävar efter en inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Som arbetsgivare ger vi alla lika möjligheter och vi välkomnar alla kvalificerade ansökningar. Vi uppmuntrar till att ansöka utan foto i ditt CV och endast fokusera på erfarenheter, färdigheter och prestationer relevanta för tjänsten.
 



  





 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Ellika Ulltin - ellika.ulltin@lakareutangranser.se (Ants Tech Recrutiers sköter rekryteringen)
 



  





 Fackliga representant för Unionen är Mia Hejdenberg, mia.hejdenberg@stockholm.msf.org
 



*Vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan!* 




  





*Läkare Utan Gränser/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) är en internationell medicinsk humanitär organisation som räddar liv och nöd där vi behövs mest. Vi bistår människor som drabbats av kriser, krig och naturkatastrofer oavsett politisk åsikt, religion eller etnisk tillhörighet. Vårt humanitära arbete styrs av våra grundprinciper; neutrala, opartiska, oberoende och att bära vittnesmål. Läkare Utan Gränser i Sverige är ca hundra medarbetare på kontoret i Liljeholmen i Stockholm som samlar in pengar, rekryterar både utsänd- och kontorspersonal, kommunicerar om det medicinska och humanitära arbetet, bedriver påverkansarbete och stödjer verksamheten runt om i världen.*

title: Senior IT-säkerhetsspecialist – SOC Level 2
description:
Vill du arbeta i frontlinjen mot cyberhot och stärka säkerheten för oss själva och för våra kunder?
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad Senior IT-säkerhetsspecialist till vårt Security Operations Center (SOC).
   

  

 I denna roll får du möjlighet att analysera och hantera säkerhetshot, samtidigt som du utvecklar vår tjänst och vägleder både kunder och kollegor.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en nyckelspelare i vårt team och arbeta med avancerade säkerhetsutredningar, incidentrespons och forensiska analyser – allt i en dynamisk och prestigelös miljö där vi ständigt strävar efter att höja kvaliteten på våra leveranser.
   

  

 Placeringsort: Stockholm, Malmö eller Göteborg
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

* Övervaka, analysera och hantera säkerhetshändelser i våra kunders mest kritiska IT-miljöer
* Agera vid säkerhetsincidenter och genomföra säkerhetsbedömningar för att minimera risker
* Bidra till att utveckla och förbättra SOC-tjänsten genom automation och processeffektivisering
* Stötta teamet i den dagliga verksamheten och höja kvaliteten på leveransen
* Delta i kunddialoger och presentationer samt ge rekommendationer för att stärka cybersäkerheten
* Vid behov delta och/eller leda i incidentrespons och forensiska utredningar


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 Vi söker en analytisk och lösningsorienterad specialist med stark förståelse för IT-säkerhet och nätverk. Du trivs i en roll där du får ta egna initiativ och bidra till utvecklingen av både tjänsten och teamet.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom IT-säkerhet, nätverk, data eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en SOC-miljö, gärna på Level 2 eller högre
* Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhetsverktyg (SIEM, IDS/IPS, SOAR)
* Förmåga att leda projekt och vägleda och utveckla juniora analytiker
* Mycket goda kommunikationsfärdigheter i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**
* Certifieringar inom IT/Cybersäkerhet (t.ex. CompTIA Security+, CISSP)
* Erfarenhet av molnsäkerhet och drift i Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud
* Kunskap inom säkerhetsarkitektur och säkerhetsramverk
* Erfarenhet av automation & script inom säkerhetsområdet.


 Tjänsten kan vara placerad i säkerhetsklass, vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning kan behöva genomföras innan anställning.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En stimulerande och tekniskt avancerad arbetsmiljö där du får arbeta med den senaste säkerhetstekniken
* Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla vårt SOC och våra tjänster
* Stöd för vidareutbildning och certifieringar inom cybersäkerhet
* Ett sammansvetsat team med en kultur som präglas av kunskapsdelning, engagemang och innovation


 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas så snart vi hittar rätt kandidat. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta rekryterande chef Morgan Ivarsson (morgan.ivarsson@cgi.com) för dialog.
   

  

 Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Internet Marketplace Platforms, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**Platform** 




**Gelato** 
 is an
 **AI-first** 
 , cloud-native platform transforming local, on-demand production and delivery — with zero physical assets. We power:
 


* **Global production orchestration** 
 : connecting e-commerce customers to 130+ partners across 32 countries. From AI-guided plate design to smart routing and logistics, we deliver to over 5 billion people in under 72 hours—faster, greener, smarter.
* **GelatoConnect** 
 : our AI-driven print production OS that helps producers master digital printing — from inventory to shipping — by automating every step: procurement, prepress, printing, packaging, and dispatch. It’s machine-agnostic, real-time, and built for uptime, precision, and profitability.



  





**AI at the Core** 




 We are not just early adopters of AI — we’re
 **AI-native builders** 
 . Across engineering, product, and operations, we embrace AI to accelerate innovation:
 


* **AI-first development** 
 using LLMs for code generation, testing, documentation, and design exploration.
* **Autonomous AI agents** 
 driving platform resilience, observability, cost control, and internal workflow automation.
* **AI-native product features** 
 built into GelatoConnect and the core platform — improving routing, personalization, and production optimization.
* A culture of
 **continuous experimentation** 
 with RAG, agent orchestration, prompt engineering, and model fine-tuning.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Ensure 24/7 platform operations, including on-call support and incident response.
* Build and evolve
 **AI agents** 
 that automate scaling, recovery, and diagnostics through control-plane patterns and event-driven logic.
* Manage
 **multi-cloud infrastructure** 
 , including serverless, through declarative, automated workflows.
* Collaborate with the
 **Delivery Platform** 
 team to improve DevEx with intelligent internal tooling.
* Drive
 **reliability, observability, and cost-efficiency** 
 across Gelato’s global infrastructure.
* Enable engineers with
 **self-service, secure, and scalable delivery pipelines** 
 .



  





**Qualifications** 



* Deep understanding of
 **Linux fundamentals** 
 (processes, I/O, filesystems, networking, memory management, system internals).
* Deep experience with
 **AWS** 
 (primary)
 **and GCP** 
 (bonus), including cost optimizations, EKS, networking, S3, VPC peering, IAM, and related services.
* Strong understanding of
 **Kubernetes internals** 
 , including networking, security, and cluster operations.
* Hands-on experience with
 **GitOps workflows** 
 (e.g. ArgoCD) and
 **Infrastructure as Code** 
 using Terraform.
* Proficient in
 **Python, Go** 
 , or other languages — with a willingness to learn Go if not already familiar.
* Comfortable using
 **AI development tools** 
 like Cursor, Claude, and coding with LLMs.



  





 Experience with or strong interest in building
 **AI agents and RAG workflows** 
 , with a commitment to learn if needed.
 



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Lösningsarkitekt  BI
description:
Lösningsarkitekt BI
   

  

 Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du en passionerad lösningsarkitekt inom Data & Analytics? Vill du vara en del av ett dynamiskt och innovativt team som arbetar med den senaste tekniken? Då är Data Insight-teamet på CGI i Stockholm rätt plats för dig!
   

  

 Vi befinner oss i ett expansivt skede och söker nu en driven kollega som vill vara med på vår spännande resa.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta hands-on med en bred variation av uppgifter, från traditionell data warehouse-utveckling till avancerad analys och arkitekturfrågor.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer kunna komma att:
   

  

* Ansvara för leveranser och leda projekt från start till mål
* Arbeta nära våra kunder i en rådgivande roll och hjälpa dem att nå sina affärsmål
* Samarbeta med ett engagerat team och stora erkända partners som Microsoft, Databricks och Snowflake


 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö med fokus på innovation och utveckling
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt
* Stora möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling
* Ett starkt och stöttande team som värdesätter samarbete och kunskapsdelning
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden och balans mellan arbete och privatliv


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbetat med data- och molnlösningar Azure, Azure Databricks Power BI / Fabric
* Förståelse för och erfarenhet av datamodellering
* Erfarenhet av att bearbeta data inom en data warehouse/ lakehouse -miljö
* Erfarenhet av att fånga krav och omsätta dem i lösningar
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet inom analytics


 Det är också meriterande om du har:
   

  

* En högskoleexamen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller civilingenjörsexamen
* Viss erfarenhet av programmering/utveckling och agila metoder


**Vem är du?**
 Du är en person som delar med dig av din kunskap, är ödmjuk och lätt att samarbeta med. Du kan hantera många bollar i luften samtidigt och tar egna initiativ. Du är självgående, utåtriktad och affärsmässig, och du brinner för att arbeta med både människor och teknik. Vi förutsätter att du behärskar svenska och engelska väl i både tal och skrift.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
