 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Du är välkommen att ställa eventuella frågor till Christian Carlborg, Director Consulting Services, via e-post: christian.carlborg@cgi.com.
   

  

**CGI**
 På CGI drivs vi av insikter där vi levererar kompletta, skalbara och hållbara IT- och affärstjänster som utformas globalt och levereras lokalt. Vi strävar efter att arbeta nära våra kunder, detta genom djup branschkunskap och en förståelse för kundens utmaningar.
   

  

 Kombinationen av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder och innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: CRM Growth Lead
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.* 




  





**Why Rebtel?** 




 When you join Rebtel, you become part of a global team, bringing together diverse minds from every corner of the world. Our headquarter is nestled in Stockholm and here we strike a balance between dedicated work and more relaxed activities. Every Friday the unmistakable aroma of freshly popped popcorn fills the air, but our celebrations encompass everything from minor and major common accomplishments to cinnamon bun day.
 



  





**What will you do?** 




 As the CRM Growth Lead who will own and drive our customer lifecycle strategy, leveraging data to enhance user engagement and retention across different touch points. This is a high-impact role for a growth-minded marketer passionate about personalization at scale and creating lifecycle journeys that convert.
 



  





 You will lead the vision and execution of our CRM function that consists of one CRM specialist. Working cross-functionally with Product, Data, Brand, and Customer Support teams to drive measurable results and sustainable user growth and retention ensuring consistent and culturally resonant messaging for our global audience.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Define, implement, and optimize CRM strategy across the entire Rebtel user lifecycle, from onboarding to winback.
* Develop and own CRM KPIs and regularly report on campaign performance and learnings.
* Plan, launch, and iterate on campaigns to improve onboarding, upsell/cross-sell, reduce churn, and increase loyalty in collaboration with a CRM campaign specialist.
* Work with data and analytics teams to develop predictive models (e.g. churn likelihood, propensity to purchase) for micro-segments to deliver relevant, timely, and personalized communication.
* Ownership over CRM tools (Braze) and ensure efficient automation, targeting, and A/B testing setups.



  





**Requirements** 



* 4–7+ years in CRM & lifecycle marketing, ideally in B2C tech, mobile app, or subscription business.
* Deep knowledge of CRM tools (e.g., Braze, Leanplum, Iterable, Salesforce Marketing Cloud or similar).
* Strong analytical mindset; experience working with SQL and customer data platforms (CDPs) is a plus.
* Proven ability to execute A/B tests and iterate quickly based on insights. Passion for customer-centric growth, retention, and behavioral psychology.
* Experience working with multicultural or global audiences is a strong plus.
* Excellent communication and project management skills; able to drive initiatives across departments.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.).



  





**Our Offer To You** 




  





 At Rebtel, you are the most important asset and we strive to provide a comprehensive package of benefits and perks that enhance your well-being and work experience. Here are some of the things you can expect from us:
 


* Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.



  





 Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.
 



  





*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: GenAI Technology Consultant/Architect
job_function: Business Development, Information Technology, and Engineering
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you an avid technologist who enjoys solving complex data and technical consulting challenges?
   

  

 Are you hungry to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment as part of a very successful global technology consulting company? If so, then EPAM is looking for a hands-on
 **Technology Consultant – Architect who is passionate about GenAI and Data in general,** 
 to be part of the continued strong growth of our team in Sweden and be part of a strategic and critical program in GenAI transformation area, end-to-end, for an important client in automotive & construction equipment sector.
   

  

 In this role, you will be accountable for assisting our client with multiple critical technology and architectural decisions, advising and guiding them, as well as advising and guiding EPAM team in the area of Data, AI & GenAI. You will be working alongside globally renowned and award-winning design, development and technology teams who are passionate about what they do and how they do it. You will play a key role in building strong business and technology relationships and take a ‘hands-on’ approach to define, deliver and drive a culture of continuous improvement.
   

  

**This role requires presence in the client's office in Gothenburg 2-3 days per week.**
**Responsibilities**
* Head the account's Data, AI and GenAI architecture and engineering capability and work on critical strategic projects to enable the client to establish and scale a state-of-the-art GenAI platform
* Manage architecture engagements, identify and design solutions, oversee major transformation through execution phases
* Create and present deep technical architecture documents to the relevant teams
* Partner with internal and client senior technical leaders and wider global architects/engineers as part of your broader remit
* Direct our technology consultancy efforts by creating and presenting POCs, driving architecture proposals, as well as providing pre-sales and RFP support
* Maintain a strong understanding of technical solutions and architecture design trends and best practices and stay abreast of cutting-edge data technologies
* Share experience, knowledge and vision with EPAM colleagues and client teams
* Participate in seminars, meetups, mentoring, training programs


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field or relevant work experience
* Extensive knowledge and experience in GenAI, AI/ML, its principles, relevant technologies, GenAI evangelist and promoter
* Data Architect & Data Technology Consultant with extensive experience in setting up and managing various data platforms on Azure (and optionally AWS/Google)
* Extensive knowledge and experience in Databricks
* Fluent English speaker with Swedish being a strong advantage


**Nice to have**
* Understanding of Business Driven Development and Business Driven Architecture


**We offer**
* EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
* Company’s pension plan
* Private healthcare insurance
* Safety & life insurance
* Gym discounts
* Wellness Grant (SEK 2000)
* Corporate Programs including Employee Referral Program with rewards
* Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
* \*All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements

title: SAP Solution Architect in Sourcing and Procurement
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 At Scania, we are on an exciting journey of transformation—modernizing our industrial operations and evolving into a more data-centric, agile, and future-ready organization. Our Digital Core team plays a vital role in this journey by delivering world-class IT solutions, with SAP S/4HANA at the heart of our ERP backbone.
   

  

 We’re a collaborative, forward-thinking team working at the intersection of business and technology. Our work supports procurement, production, logistics, and finance—and we’re proud to help shape the foundation of Scania’s digital future.
   

  

 If you’re inspired by change, innovation, and making a real impact—this is where you belong.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for an experienced SAP Solution Architect within the sourcing and procurement domain to help drive our SAP transformation. You will be part of our Source-to-Pay area, where you’ll work across functions to design scalable, efficient, and innovative SAP solutions.
   

  

 Your main mission will be to contribute to the setup and refinement of our global SAP template, ensuring alignment between business needs and our evolving system landscape. As a key part of the team, you’ll influence future direction, assess new SAP product opportunities, and guide technical design decisions in projects that span across Scania and the broader TRATON Group.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Lead architecture design and development activities within SAP S/4HANA for sourcing and procurement.
* Shape and evolve the global SAP template, supporting both ongoing and future project releases.
* Evaluate SAP tools (e.g., Central Procurement Hub, Fieldglass, SAP ECM) and identify opportunities for Scania.
* Safeguard solution integrity by promoting standard processes and scalable architecture.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, define scope, and support integration or customer-specific solutions.
* Guide change management and participate in review and governance processes.
* Share your knowledge with peers and contribute to Scania’s IT innovation culture.


**Who You Are**
 We believe you are a curious, solutions-oriented professional with a strong foundation in SAP sourcing and procurement. You’re as comfortable navigating complex technical challenges as you are engaging with stakeholders from different backgrounds.
   

  

 You likely bring:
   

  

  

* 5+ years’ experience in SAP sourcing and procurement, covering direct and/or indirect materials.
* Deep understanding of procurement business processes and system integration.
* Experience across multiple phases of SAP project lifecycles, ideally in S/4HANA environments.
* Familiarity with tools such as SAP BTP, Fieldglass, SAP ECM, VIM, and integrations with non-SAP systems (advantageous).
* Exposure to the automotive industry or other large-scale manufacturing environments (preferred).
* A collaborative and pragmatic mindset, with strong stakeholder management skills.
* Excellent communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus).


 You’re passionate about innovation, enjoy solving complex problems, and are excited to work in a space where your contributions can shape the future of an entire industry.
   

  

*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-06-30. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: andy.arens@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: System Architect ASIC
description:
**Join our Team**
**Our Exciting Opportunity**
 Do you want to develop advanced silicon technology with cutting-edge innovation in a single chip? Then look no further! The product engineering unit Silicon drives the development of industry-leading digital ASIC technologies, with vibrant technology hubs across multiple sites. We are looking for experienced system architects for system-on-chip development who will drive the innovation of our digital ASIC products in the ever-evolving world of telecommunications.
   

  

 As an experienced member of our Silicon Systems & Architecture department, you bring skills and insight that will be instrumental in ensuring the delivery of high-quality system solutions that shape the future of global connectivity. In this role, you will be more than an engineer; you play a pivotal role in which you lead, innovate, and ensure that the product features are systemised into functional requirements and brought into our digital ASIC IPs. Your expertise will be critical for turning game-changing ideas into real-world solutions shaping the 5G and 6G eras.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Drive silicon functional systemization activities of radio functions, features, interfaces, configuration capabilities, and sub-systems, that are to be implemented in ASIC function architecture blocks.
* Act as lead architect to develop ASIC requirement specifications for radio signal processing..
* Innovate concepts for functional features by participating or driving pre-development studies aligned with future product needs for ASIC systemization.
* Systemize and architect hardware solutions for product features by breaking down system requirements from product to ASIC function level and sub-system level.
* Stay up to date on key industry trends, academic research, technology standards and development in the System-on-Chip domain and spread the acquired knowledge across the silicon systems community (e.g. in form of feature roadmaps).


**We are currently looking to strengthen areas with the following disciplines:**
* Radio control, incl. event control, beam control, complex data (IQ) control, and key peripheral sub-systems such as processors, memories, security, etc.
* Radio measurement and supervision, incl. antenna calibration, test memories, power monitoring, interconnects such as JESD204, etc.


**The skills you bring:**
* Experience in radio systemization and relevant disciplines for any of the above-mentioned areas that we are looking to strengthen.
* Master of Science, Ph.D., Post-doc, or similar degrees in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering Physics, or equivalent education.
* Proficiency within the field of signal processing, telecommunication systems, radio technology and preferably the silicon domain.
* Knowledge about system-on-chip development, embedded systems, and ASIC or IP development.
* Knowledge of wireless standards (e.g. GSM, WCDMA, LTE, NR) under the 3gpp umbrella, as well as network standards (e.g. IEEE 802, etc.).
* Strong communication skills, with a focus on documentation (e.g. authoring requirement specifications) and the ability to drive complex technical discussions to a solution.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Ioannis Tilaveridis]]

title: Senior Data Architect - Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Would you like to join a community where you will work with the latest technology and where you can grow your competence in a systematic manner? Would you also like to have flexibility in your work and working hours, and do you have experience in transformation projects? Then this is the place for you!
   

  

 Tietoevry Tech Services is thrilled to embark on an exciting journey under new ownership. This change opens up new possibilities, challenges, and growth opportunities for our company and our employees. We are looking for talented people who want to join us on this exciting journey and help shape the digital landscape in the Nordics.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Tech Services as a Senior Data Architect:**
 In this position there are two main directions that you would utilize:
   

  

* Business to technology: In this direction, you would be working closely with customer business, IT and other stakeholders with your Tietoevry Tech Services colleagues to translate their business goals into IT architecture and finally into technical solutions utilizing cloud native tools and services.
* Technology to business: In this approach, you would bring thoughts and ideas on how our customers can benefit from cloud solutions in the best possible way.


**“Sounds interesting. So, what would be required from me?”**
* We expect you to have previous experience in design/implementation, deployment verification, migration / development application to Azure, GCP or AWS.
* Several years of experience in the traditional IT in addition to cloud.
* You should be enthusiast towards data and cloud architecture, designing and/or being a strong builder and executioner of these architectures including modelling of them.
* Communication with Swedish language is must as you would be working directly with customer stakeholders which has swedish as their company language. Also some documentation customers are having might be written in Swedish.


**It Is Great If You Also Have**
* It really helps if you are possessing a history of successful IT consulting and architecture engagements with large-scale customers.
* Event-based / real-time architecture experience with technologies such as Kafka on Confluent.
* Hands-on experience on AI, ML, GenAI is big plus as several customers of ours have started their AI / GenAI journey.
* We provide assistance for our customers with their Data & Analytics and Roadmap development based on their Business goals (capturing As-Is state, To-be architecture and gaps) and building Transition state architecture. Experience in this kind of consulting cases is a big plus.
* Analytics domain experience on technologies such as Snowflake, Synapse, Databricks.
* Several of our customers are working with some kind of agile model like SAFe or Scrum so agile methods should be familiar to you. But if not, we have great learning capabilities also from these areas for you to master.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!

title: Projektledare inom automations- eller systemingenjör med erfarenhet av produktionssystem
description:
**Din titel:** 
 Projektledare inom automations- eller systemingenjör med erfarenhet av produktionssystem
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Danderyd – Sverige (på plats)
   

  

**Vår avdelning:** 
 Teknikutveckling (Manufacturing Engineering)
   

  

 Är du en erfaren projektledare inom automation eller systemingenjör med erfarenhet av produktionssystem, redo för en ny utmaning? Kom och bli en del av vårt dynamiska team och ta en roll som kommer att vara avgörande för att utveckla processer som möjliggör leverans av marknadsledande produkter och lösningar!
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som vår projektledare inom automation och systemutveckling kommer du att leda våra insatser inom produktionsautomation och spela en avgörande roll i att definiera våra framtida mål. Du kommer att fungera som teknisk rådgivare för det befintliga teamet, vägleda i upprättandet av nya produktionsprocesser och stödja produktionslinjer. Ditt mål kommer att vara att förbättra effektiviteten i vår produktion genom att implementera automation.
   

  

**Primära arbetsuppgifter**
* Säkerställa att funktionella och tekniska krav uppfylls.
* Planera och implementera automatiseringssteg för att effektivisera produktionsprocesser.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsavdelningen och produktionsteam för att driftsätta system och identifiera potentiella förbättringar eller nya möjligheter.
* Arbeta direkt med produktionen för att ge vägledning under den initiala uppstartsfasen och fasen för användartestning (User Acceptance Testing) av integrationen.


**Vilka färdigheter och erfarenheter bör du ha med dig?**
* Kandidatexamen eller högre inom robotik/mekatronik eller liknande områden.
* Minst 5 års praktisk erfarenhet av att implementera och effektivisera olika produktionsstyrningssystem - MES (Manufacturing Execution System) eller liknande.
* Omfattande erfarenhet av att sätta upp produktionslinjer, implementera automation och stödsystem.
* Erfarenhet av att integrera hårdvarukomponenter med mjukvarusystem för att säkerställa kommunikation och funktionalitet.
* Stark projektledningsförmåga, med förmåga att leda tvärfunktionella team och hantera flera projekt samtidigt.
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor på svenska, med förmåga att effektivt arbeta med montörer, ingenjörer, tekniker och andra intressenter.


**Dina Framtida Kollegor - Teknikutveckling**
 Teknikutvecklingsteamet inom Operation består av 9 mycket skickliga ingenjörer inom programmering, elektronik, mekanik, samt specialister inom mätteknik, fiber och optik.
   

  

 Ditt arbete sker i nära samarbete med avdelningar som Produktion, Produktionsplanering, Leverans, Konstruktion, Logistik, Inköp, utvecklingsavdelningen och ledningsgruppen inom Operations, för att fortsätta leverera produkter i världsklass till våra kunder.
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit:
 *www.trimble.com*
 Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment
   

  

 We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
   

  

 We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.

title: Director of AI Product Management, Trilogy (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
job_function: Engineering, Product Management, and Project Management
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
You've had experience taking a software product from zero to launch, but you know that deep, thoughtful product work doesn't end. You're the kind of person who figures things out without a map, who goes deep on understanding the user, the problem, and the domain until a clear path emerges. You don't want to manage a backlog or fill in a spec. You want ownership of a goal that matters and the space to pursue it with speed, insight, and focus.
   

  

 At Trilogy, we're flipping the model. You're not here to "own the roadmap". You're here to make one thing true: a real-world, measurable business outcome. You get one clear goal—something that should happen when users interact with the product—and your job is to make it happen. You'll need to build deep domain insights using AI as your peer and feedback from users, codify them so that both your teammates and AI can act on it, and steer the product through fast, data-backed iterations until you hit the outcome.
   

  

 You'll be joining a team that doesn't celebrate busywork or beautiful process diagrams. You'll be there to drive impact and make decisions rooted in user data, fast feedback loops, and sharp insight. If you're sick of playing the PM game and want to actually change the game, please apply. We're building what product management should have been all along.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build BrainLifts: A structured, evolving body of expert insights that sharpens AI tools, guides decisions, and proves you understand the domain.
* Make Product Iterations: Small, data-driven product enhancements shipped weekly to steer the product toward a measurable outcome.
* Building Domain Expertise: Acquire deep, structured understanding of a specific domain so that the team can make higher-quality decisions, create more tailored outputs, and communicate with authority.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Spending a whole month developing a new feature; we aim to ship new features on a weekly basis
* Writing lengthy and exhaustive PRDs, managing backlogs, or defining every screen or edge case
* Building technical solutions or software architecture


**Basic Requirements**
**Director of AI Product Management key responsibilities**
* At least 4 years in a product leadership role where they personally shaped the product vision, defined the roadmap, owned the core problem-solution hypothesis, and improved it based on usage metrics or customer feedback.
* Previous experience taking a full stand-alone software product (i.e. not a just feature/module) from zero to one, i.e., launched at least one software product that reached external real users.
* Previous experience in product management in the enterprise software space
* Enthusiasm for using AI in your daily work (e.g., research, analysis, synthesis, or strategy)


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with us**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5623-SE-Stockhol-DirectorofAIPr1

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
* Stockholm, Sweden
* Software Engineering

  

At Rillion, we're looking for a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer to join our AI product team. You'll help us improve and expand the machine learning components that power our Accounts Payable (AP) automation. From idea to deployment, you'll work closely with others across the company to bring smart, ML-driven features into our product. If you enjoy solving real problems with data and want to be part of a collaborative, fast-moving team, we’d love to have you on board!


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------



You’ll play a key role in building and integrating custom Machine Learning functionalities into our SaaS products, with a focus on developing our ML platform and creating data-driven solutions tailored to our needs:


* Develop and scale our machine learning platform using Databricks.
* Design and implement custom ML models tailored to real-world AP automation challenges.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify user needs and integrate ML solutions seamlessly into our SaaS platform.
* Stay informed on the latest ML advancements and contribute to shaping our ML strategy and solution design.

**What You'll Bring:**
----------------------


* Proven experience delivering ML solutions in SaaS or digital product environments.
* Solid experience with ML / Data frameworks such as PyTorch, PySpark or similar.
* Hands-on experience in production ML pipelines, including batch and real-time inference.
* Experience working with both generic and customer tailored models.
* A problem-solving mindset with a collaborative, proactive approach, and a curiosity to explore new solutions while staying up to date.
* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

**Bonus skills:**
-----------------


* Experience working with Databricks in a production environment.
* Experience with software development and microservices.

**What we offer:**
------------------


* Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company.
* Join a collaborative and supportive product team that will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to production.
* Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path.
* Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
* A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package.
* Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office.
* Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views).

**The recruitment process:**
----------------------------



We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment. If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Victoria Stjernström at victoria.stjernstrom@rillion.com.


  
**About Rillion**
-----------------


Since 1993, Rillion has been on a mission to make AP automation and payments friction-free – where processes run smoothly, data is trustworthy, and peace of mind is the norm. We believe invoicing should be simple, fast – and dare we say – fun.



With over 2500 customers in 50 countries, our mission is to empower finance teams to feel confident in their choices and daily work. Our expertise and experience, built over decades, enables us to offer tailored solutions that fit the unique workflows of various industries.

title: Senior QA/Test Engineer – Payments Domain

title: Quant Engineer - Sports Betting AI
description:
**About Kambi**


*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*


*Our vision is to create the world's leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*

**About Tzeract**



Welcome to Tzeract! We're a startup of 20+ engineers within Kambi Group, revolutionizing sports betting with AI, advanced analytics and real-time data. Our small, hybrid, agile team is creating innovative technology that powers next-generation betting experiences. With the backing of Kambi's global resources, we'll offer the opportunity to work on complex mathematical projects that scale across international markets. Get to know us better at www.tzeract.com.


**Role overview**  

Do you get excited about math and statistics? In this role, you'll be key to refining the models that drive our AI-powered odds compiling. Your work will involve using machine learning and simulations to analyze sports data. You'll also contribute to creating reliable, well-structured code and ensuring systems are optimized for performance.



Do you have to be a sports fanatic? Of course not. As part of a team that collaborates closely with data engineers and scientists, you'll apply your mathematical expertise to enhance algorithms and share ideas for improvements. This role offers a mix of support and autonomy, requiring curiosity and initiative to solve complex problems.


**What you'll do:**


* Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate algorithms into our production systems, ensuring they operate efficiently at scale.
* Design, develop, and implement advanced mathematical models and machine learning algorithms for predictive analytics in sports betting.
* Conduct statistical analysis to understand data patterns, validate models, and enhance accuracy.
* Work with large-scale, real-time, and historical sports data sets, applying quantitative techniques to extract actionable insights.
* Communicate complex quantitative analyses and concepts to non-technical team members to inform strategy decisions.


**What we believe you have:**


* Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
* Experience in mathematical/statistical modeling and machine learning.
* Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries like NumPy and Pandas.
* Familiarity with TensorFlow, PyTorch, SciPy, or similar machine learning frameworks.
* Ability to describe reality through mathematics and implement solutions into practical applications.
* Able to multitask different roles-whether it's tackling complex math problems or contributing to development tasks.


**It's a plus if you have any of the following:**


* PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
* Open-source projects in ML or simulation, especially if relevant to the role's focus areas.
* Familiarity with databases.


**Note**. This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden. We do not support relocation packages.  

**Note 2**. Due to summer vacation you can expect delays in the process and responses.

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***


*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*


***Creating an inclusive environment***


*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*


*#wearekambi*
company_description: Kambi is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed B2C gaming operators.

title: Software Test Engineer Penetration Testing
description:
**Role:** Software Test Engineer – Penetration Testing
  
**Seniority Level:** Intermediate
  
**Location:** Gothenburg, Sweden
  
**Remote Work:** 0%
  
**Application Deadline:** 27 June 2025
  
**Workload:** 100%
  
Assignment Overview
  
Our client is seeking a Software Test Engineer with a specialization in penetration testing and cybersecurity for a long-term assignment in Gothenburg. The role focuses on developing and executing both automated and manual tests to ensure robust, secure, and standards-compliant automotive software systems.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Design and execute both automated and manual test cases.
  
Develop and maintain test environments.
  
Analyze test results, log defects, and collaborate with developers for resolution.
  
Ensure compliance with ISO 26262, Automotive SPICE, and ISO 21434 standards.
  
Continuously improve test procedures and monitor their effectiveness.
  
Conduct code reviews and offer feedback regarding testability.
  
Create test scripts for HiL (Hardware-in-the-Loop) and SiL (Software-in-the-Loop) testing.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement automated testing frameworks.
  
  

General Role Purpose
  
The Software Test Engineer ensures that automotive embedded systems and software components meet quality, security, and performance standards, primarily within Electric Drive Units (EDU) and other automotive domains.
  
Core Responsibilities
  
Develop comprehensive software test plans aligned with functional and non-functional requirements.
  
Automate testing processes to enhance repeatability and efficiency.
  
Detect, document, and track software defects using standardized tools.
  
Ensure system and software compliance with automotive safety and regulatory requirements.
  
Communicate test results and quality metrics clearly to stakeholders.
  
Conduct performance and regression testing for software releases.
  
  

Authority & Influence
  
Approve or reject software builds based on test outcomes.
  
Propose and implement automated test systems and frameworks.
  
Suggest improvements to tools and processes within the QA workflow.
  
  

Required Skills & Experience
  
**Programming:** Proficiency in Python and clean code practices
  
**Cybersecurity:** Hands-on experience with penetration testing and cybersecurity in embedded systems
  
**Testing Tools:** Jenkins, GitLab CI, Travis CI
  
JIRA, Codebeamer, GitHub/GitLab
  
**Protocols:** UDS, CAN, XCP, ETK
  
**Standards Knowledge:** ISO 26262, ISO 14229, ISO 21434
  
**Hardware Integration:** Familiarity with microcontrollers and automotive systems
  
**Test Documentation:** Ability to write test cases, plans, scenarios, and detailed bug reports
  
**Manual & Automated Testing:** Experience in both methods with solid documentation skills
  
  

Experience Level
  
University degree or equivalent in a technical field
  
3–7 years of hands-on experience in software testing in automotive or embedded domains
  
Demonstrates independence, accountability, and the ability to resolve complex issues
  
Recognized by peers for expertise and consistent delivery

title: Design Engineer - IKEA of Sweden, Älmhult
description:
Job Description
  
Would you like to help create a better everyday life for the many people by developing affordable products and solutions for homes around the world? At IKEA of Sweden in Älmhult, that’s exactly what they do. This is where the IKEA product range is developed and made available to stores and customers across the globe.
  
Mechanical Design plays a key role in their product development—ensuring robust construction, packaging efficiency, ease of assembly, and customer satisfaction. Smart solutions and good design shape their customers’ perceptions of quality.
  
Within the Bedroom Furniture Range Area, they are looking for a Mechanical Design Engineer to join one of their Storage Solitaires teams. In this role, you will be part of a cross-functional product development team with end-to-end responsibility for mechanical design. You will ensure that their products are ready for production and provide a great experience for customers when they assemble them at home.
  
You will work closely with stakeholders throughout the value chain to find optimal constructions that balance cost, customer needs, and sustainability.
  
  

**As a Mechanical Design Engineer, you will:**  

* Develop technical product designs and solutions that meet product requirements, business goals, and customer needs.
* Contribute to the exploration and implementation of new materials and innovations.
* Apply IKEA standard materials, solutions, and platforms to drive cost efficiency and support sustainability targets.
* Collaborate with development partners, designers, and manufacturers to ensure design specifications are met.
* Evaluate constructions through calculations and simulations, working with our in-house FEA engineers prior to prototype testing.
* Identify and mitigate product risks to ensure safe, high-performing products.
* Focus on both supplier and customer perspectives—designing for manufacturing and easy customer assembly.
* Create, document, and maintain accurate digital 3D models and 2D drawings, including all relevant dimensions and tolerances, in line with IKEA CAD standards.
* Produce technical documentation such as assembly instructions, assembly time estimates, bills of components, and other relevant specifications.
* Break down product constructions into relevant part structures for development and production.


Qualifications
  
Ikea is looking for a collaborative team player who is passionate about creating the best possible product for customers—at the right price, with the right quality, and with a strong focus on sustainability. You are structured, fact-based in your decision-making, and able to prioritize and share insights to support the business.
  
  

**Must have:**  

* A higher technical education or university degree in Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent experience), with solid knowledge of material science, FEM analysis, and mechanical design.
* Proficiency in using CAD software and product lifecycle management tools such as SolidWorks and PTC Windchill.


**Nice to have:**  

* A few years of experience in product development.
* Hands-on experience with mechanical design, 3D modeling, geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T), simulation, and drawing techniques


Strong communication skills and the ability to drive your own work are highly valued. To succeed in this role, you’ll need both analytical and creative abilities, and the capability to turn knowledge and ideas into innovative technical product solutions.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Are you an innovative and results-driven Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for cutting-edge AI applications? Do you thrive in optimizing algorithms, refining models, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
  
The Engineering business area at Sigma Connectivity WSI in Stockholm continues to grow. Here, we mainly work on exciting assignments at the client's site (on-site consulting). Your skills will develop through interactions and work at client companies.
  
  

**About the Role:**  

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing and optimizing machine learning models for real-world applications in different consultant assignments. You will work with our clients as an onsite consultant, where some tasks could be within Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems, enhancement of neural network performance, and implementation of strategies to mitigate class imbalances in datasets. Your experience of CI/CD, version control, and model deployment will be key in ensuring efficient workflow automation.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Master's degree in Machine Learning or a related field.
  
Strong proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks.
  
Experience with CI/CD tools, Git version control, and collaborative software development.
  
Hands-on experience in active learning techniques, dataset analysis, and optimization methods.
  
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on model performance improvement.
  
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional team environment.
  
  

**Preferred Experience:**  

Prior work in Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems.
  
Knowledge of Knowledge Distillation techniques and experience in semantic segmentation tasks.
  
Experience digitizing handwritten records using AI-based text recognition methods.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
We are looking for someone with the drive to learn new things and the curiosity to take on assignments at various client companies. You can easily clarify your skills and make yourself understood when diving deep into the tech world with technically knowledgeable people, but also when discussing technology with "technical dummies." If you are also proactive and have a passion for sharing your experience, as well as being able to work in a team, you are probably even more suited for us!
  
We offer
  
A complete insurance package with occupational pension
  
30 days of vacation
  
Wellness benefits
  
The possibility of car leasing
  
An inclusive corporate culture where we support each other and gladly share experiences and knowledge
  
Both junior and senior technically skilled colleagues who love to develop cool products
  
Fun at work
  
Team activities with WSI colleagues and trips with the entire Sigma Connectivity (our mothership)
  
**Our core values:** "Committed, Inventive, Passionate, Always Together"
  
  

Are you ready to take on this challenge and make a difference? Apply now!

title: Production Technician
description:
Production Technician – Mechanical Maintenance & Automation
  
  

We are a group of people who think differently, have a passion for entrepreneurship and strive to maintain a flat organization where we all are expected to make a difference. We believe in making the impossible possible together – by building on each individual's personal strengths. Our goal is to change the way cities in Europe are heated and cooled, do you want to shape the future with us?
  
Our world is in the midst of an energy transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources. At Qvantum, we have developed a solution to tackle a difficult challenge that no one has been able to solve before – how to enable the many people in the big cities to live a life without dependence on fossil fuels for heating and cooling at an affordable price. We have developed a wide range of smart heat pump solutions built on modern software. The products are suitable for everything from small apartments to large property complexes and entire residential blocks. The next generation of heat pumps are not only very energy efficient but also designed to be an active node in the electrical grid. Qvantum has developed a series of new capabilities for this purpose including our heat pump to grid (HP2G), flexready®, thermal battery and digital doctor features.
  
We are currently more than 350 colleagues, located in 8 different countries, and we continue to grow at a rapid pace. With factories in Sweden and Hungary, multiple R&D centres and world class specialist competencies in heat pump hardware & software development, energy systems and industrialization we are aiming to become one of the leading players in our segment in Europe.
  
We invite you to an exciting company building journey filled with development opportunities and an inclusive work environment that encourages professional and personal development together with dynamic and forward-thinking colleagues! Join Us!
  
About the role
  
We are scaling up operations at our Åstorp factory and are now looking for a skilled Production Technician with solid hands-on experience in industrial machine maintenance and technical optimization.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

Preventive and corrective maintenance of production machinery and automation systems
  
Optimization and retrofit of existing machines
  
Working with industrial robots
  
PLC programming and troubleshooting
  
Collaborating daily with R&D, Sales, Production, Quality and other departments
  
Contributing to in-house 3D printing of machine components
  
  

Qualifications
  
Educational background as a Mechanical Engineer, Electrical Engineer, or equivalent professional experience in a technical/industrial setting
  
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in industrial machinery maintenance
  
Solid knowledge in mechatronics, mechanics, automation, electronics, hydraulics, and pneumatics
  
Experience with industrial robotics – preferably Kuka and Yaskawa
  
PLC programming skills (any platform)
  
Comfortable working with digital tools and maintenance systems
  
Strong understanding of industrial safety and regulations
  
Experience of 3D printing and CAD
  
  

**Personal traits:**  

Problem-solver with a structured approach
  
Curious, self-driven, and resilient under pressure
  
A true team player who also thrives when working independently
  
Excellent communication skills and used to cross-functional collaboration
  
  

**Language requirements:** English fluency (written and spoken)
  
Swedish is a plus
  
To thrive in the role, we believe that you appreciate the scale-up phase we are in, where learning and flexibility is needed in combination with a strong drive to build systematic ways of working and implement new tools and methods. We believe you have a strength in following through, attention to details and are driven by creating results. You have a long-term perspective and value both working independently with your team and collaborating with colleagues across different functions and across Europe.

title: QA Engineer
description:
**QA Engineer at Coody**


Looking for the freedom of freelancing with the security of a full-time job? At Coody, we offer the best of both worlds—high salary, full benefits, and the flexibility to work remotely on cutting-edge projects.

  

On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%. How do we do it?


The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs - no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: **you**.

  

Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life for your own priorities - **Gravity Free Consulting**

**WHY COODY?**

* Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
* Freedom & Flexibility: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
* Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Topgolf, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Volvo Cars, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.

 **ABOUT US**


Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consists of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.


We’re more than a company — we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We cut through bureaucracy to focus on what matters—our consultants. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.  

  

  



**WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**


As a QA Engineer consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.


You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute to well tested and launch ready products and applications to match users and stakeholders requirements. You're also an important person to automate the test-cycle.


You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

 **WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

* 5+ years of experience working as a QA Engineer
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done

 **WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**

**Background** in building test frameworks and test cases for apps, web, backend, infrastructure or embedded

**Experience** with testing tools such as Selenium, Gtest, Pytest, Appium, Scripting etc.

**Technical expertise** in both at least a couple of programming languages together with version control and other common tools like Git, Gitlab, CVS, Subversion, Jira, Confluence

**A Solid understanding** of CI/CD pipelines

**Knowledge** about requirement management towards software developers and other stakeholders

**A degree** in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field


Excited to take your career to the next level? Apply now, and we'll be in touch!

title: Senior Linux Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**

 **Unlock Your Potential with Ericsson: Senior Linux Software Engineer Opportunity**

  

At Ericsson, we're driving innovation with a dedicated team responsible for a cutting-edge Yocto-based Linux distribution. We're on the hunt for seasoned Linux software engineers who are passionate about making a mark in the Linux ecosystem. If you have proven expertise in Yocto and a robust background in the Linux kernel, we want you to be part of our exciting mission.


Your Impact as a Senior Linux Software Engineer, you'll be at the heart of delivering high-quality solutions within Ericsson and contributing to key open-source projects that shape the future.


Whether you're in Sweden, Ireland, Finland, or the United States, your contributions matter more than your location.

 **What you will do**

* **Lead & Innovate:** Drive strategic initiatives within upstream Linux kernel & Yocto communities, amplifying Ericsson's presence.
* **Develop & Enhance:** Implement and maintain Linux kernel extensions, from Ericsson-written modules to performance optimizations.
* **Collaborate & Contribute:** Work hand-in-hand with users to refine kernel performance and support technical staff using our distribution.
* **Explore & Expand:** Dive into other FOSS projects like U-Boot, ATF, GLIBC, and push the boundaries of embedded systems.
* **Test & Perfect:** Ensure our distribution is robust and reliable through rigorous testing and prototyping.
 **The skills you bring**

  

Bring your skills to a place where they’ll be appreciated and expanded. Ideal candidates will have:  

  

* **Educational Excellence:** M.S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* **Kernel Mastery:** Proven experience in Linux kernel development with a track record of contributions (please provide patch submissions).
* **Open Source Advocate:** Familiarity with community norms and behaviors.
* **Programming Proficiency:** Expertise in C, C++, and Rust.
* **Yocto Enthusiast:** Experience with Yocto and its community.
* **Silicon Pioneer:** Experience in new silicon introduction within embedded Linux environments.
* **Communication Champion:** Strong skills to articulate ideas and collaborate effectively.
 **Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV/Resume in English.  

Last day to apply: 9th of July 2025


Please note that we do not accept, process, or respond to applications sent via e-mail.


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact David Partain, Embedded Systems R&D Manager, at david.partain@ericsson.com or Nina Juthage, Principal Talent Acquisition Partner, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

  

What happens once you apply?  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Ericsson uses a merit-based hiring approach that values people with different experiences, perspectives and skillsets. We truly believe this approach drives innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, learn more.

  

If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

  

Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Stockholm  

Job details: Developer

  

Compensation and Benefits at Ericsson  

At Ericsson, we know that our people are the key to our success. We offer a competitive package to help with your individual needs and goals.

  

Your Pay  

The salary range for this position is dependent on various factors including, but not limited to, location, and the candidate’s combination of job-related knowledge, qualifications, skills, education, training, and experience.

 **Below pay and benefits are applicable for US only:**

  

The salary range for this position is


• • Santa Clara: $191,200 – $286,800

  

Short-Term Variable Compensation Plan: Your pay also includes the opportunity for an annual bonus. Actual bonus payouts are based on performance of the business against the unit’s objectives, individual performance, and the individual bonus target. Certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply.

  

Sales Incentive Plan: Your pay also includes the opportunity for sales incentives as a part of Ericsson’s Sales Incentive Plan. Actual payouts are based on performance of the business against the unit’s objectives, individual performance, and the individual incentive target. Certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply.

  

Your Health  

Ericsson offers excellent health benefits including the choice of three medical plan options and a dental plan option that allow an employee to select the level of coverage that suits their needs. Employees will receive company credits in an amount equal to the cost that Ericsson pays toward the cost of their medical and dental premiums for themselves and eligible covered dependents.

  

Your Financial Security


We invest in both your short and long-term financial wellbeing. The Ericsson US 401(k) Plan offers an automatic 3% company contribution and Ericsson matches $1 for every $1 you put into the 401(k) Plan on the first 3% of your eligible pay, plus 50 cents on every $1 on the next 2% of eligible pay. When you contribute at least 5% of eligible pay, you are receiving Ericsson’s full matching contributions. Matching and company automatic contributions stop when your total eligible pay for the year reaches the IRS limits. Employees will also receive company credits in an amount equal to the cost of basic life insurance and basic accidental death and dismemberment coverage, as well as short-term and long-term disability coverage. Employees also have the option to participate in Ericsson’s Stock Purchase Plan.

  

Your Time  

Your work-life balance is important to us. New employees are provided a minimum of 15 days of accrued vacation, up to 3 personal days per year, 11 annual holidays, 8 hours of volunteer time, and 80 hours of sick time annually. Please note paid time off is pro-rated based on the employee’s start date. Furthermore, Ericsson provides up to 16 weeks of paid maternity leave and 6 weeks of parental or adoption leave at 100% of pay.

  

Additional Benefits  

Ericsson offers many other company-paid benefits such as financial wellness programs, educational assistance, matching gifts, and recognition programs.

Please note that we do not accept, process, or respond to applications sent via e-mail.


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact David Partain, Embedded Systems R&D Manager, at david.partain@ericsson.com or Nina Juthage, Principal Talent Acquisition Partner, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

  

What happens once you apply?  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Ericsson uses a merit-based hiring approach that values people with different experiences, perspectives and skillsets. We truly believe this approach drives innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer, learn more.

  

If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

  

Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Stockholm  

Job details: Developer

  

Compensation and Benefits at Ericsson  

At Ericsson, we know that our people are the key to our success. We offer a competitive package to help with your individual needs and goals.

  

Your Pay  

The salary range for this position is dependent on various factors including, but not limited to, location, and the candidate’s combination of job-related knowledge, qualifications, skills, education, training, and experience.

 **Below pay and benefits are applicable for US only:**

  

The salary range for this position is


• • Santa Clara: $191,200 – $286,800

  

Short-Term Variable Compensation Plan: Your pay also includes the opportunity for an annual bonus. Actual bonus payouts are based on performance of the business against the unit’s objectives, individual performance, and the individual bonus target. Certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply.

  

Sales Incentive Plan: Your pay also includes the opportunity for sales incentives as a part of Ericsson’s Sales Incentive Plan. Actual payouts are based on performance of the business against the unit’s objectives, individual performance, and the individual incentive target. Certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply.

  

Your Health  

Ericsson offers excellent health benefits including the choice of three medical plan options and a dental plan option that allow an employee to select the level of coverage that suits their needs. Employees will receive company credits in an amount equal to the cost that Ericsson pays toward the cost of their medical and dental premiums for themselves and eligible covered dependents.

  

Your Financial Security


We invest in both your short and long-term financial wellbeing. The Ericsson US 401(k) Plan offers an automatic 3% company contribution and Ericsson matches $1 for every $1 you put into the 401(k) Plan on the first 3% of your eligible pay, plus 50 cents on every $1 on the next 2% of eligible pay. When you contribute at least 5% of eligible pay, you are receiving Ericsson’s full matching contributions. Matching and company automatic contributions stop when your total eligible pay for the year reaches the IRS limits. Employees will also receive company credits in an amount equal to the cost of basic life insurance and basic accidental death and dismemberment coverage, as well as short-term and long-term disability coverage. Employees also have the option to participate in Ericsson’s Stock Purchase Plan.

  

Your Time  

Your work-life balance is important to us. New employees are provided a minimum of 15 days of accrued vacation, up to 3 personal days per year, 11 annual holidays, 8 hours of volunteer time, and 80 hours of sick time annually. Please note paid time off is pro-rated based on the employee’s start date. Furthermore, Ericsson provides up to 16 weeks of paid maternity leave and 6 weeks of parental or adoption leave at 100% of pay.

  

Additional Benefits  

Ericsson offers many other company-paid benefits such as financial wellness programs, educational assistance, matching gifts, and recognition programs.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Have you been coding for a few years and now want to use your superpowers to change how people manage their finances? Do you thrive in a modern tech environment where you can experiment, build, and create solutions that make a real impact? If so, it might be time to join
 **Lendo** 
 !🚀
   

  

**The team**
 You’ll become part of an open-minded, agile, and cross-functional team that loves to solve problems and innovate! At Lendo, everyone can have an impact. Our tech teams work closely with the business, directly contributing to continuously improving the tech and our product offerings. Through our products, we want to empower people to make smarter and more conscious financial decisions.
   

  

**A Look At What You Would Do**
* Use modern tech such as Kubernetes, Docker, PostgreSQL, GCP, CI/CD…
* Build, design, and optimise Go microservices
* Continuously create exciting new products and features, collaborating closely with colleagues
